body:
کانکست ویکی:
به ویکی پدیای کانکست خوش آمدید. 👋
بسیار خرسندیم که در اینجا حضور دارید.

✨ پل ارتباطی سریع و مطمئن بین بلکچین ها
Connext پل زدن سریع و ایمن بین بلاکچین ها و رول آپ ها را برای Web 3 که مقیاس‌پذیر، ترکیب‌پذیر و به حداقل Trust رسیده است، ایجاد می‌کند. می‌توانید از Connext برای ارسال تراکنش‌های ارزش (value) یا داده‌های تماس(calldata) در بلاکچین ها و/یا رول آپ ها استفاده کنید. برخلاف اکثر سیستم‌ها با قابلیت همکاری دیگر(interoperability)، Connext این کار را بدون معرفی هیچ گونه فرضیات اعتماد جدید یا اعتبارسنجی‌های خارجی (external validators) فعال می‌کند.

کانکست بریج
💬 یادداشت
Connext Bridge قبلاً به عنوان xPollinate شناخته می شد، رابط کاربری بریج متعارف ومرجع پیاده سازی برای Connext. در مارس 2022، xPollinate به Connext Bridge تغییر نام داد تا هویت برند Connext را تثبیت کند و استفاده از شبکه را برای کاربران نهایی ساده‌تر کند.
Connext یک شبکه زیرساخت رو به توسعه‌دهنده است که سازندگان می‌توانند از آن برای ایجاد پل‌های سریع و ایمن بین بلاک چین و رول آپ ها استفاده کنند.

Connext Bridge یک برنامه پیشرو برای کاربران و توسعه دهندگان است تا عملیات های زنجیره ای به Trust minimized واقعی را تجربه کنند. dApp نشان می دهد که توسعه دهندگان چه کاری می توانند با شبکه Connext انجام دهند. بریج بخشی از مجموعه محصولات Connext به همراه Connext SDK است.
رابط Connext Bridge منبع باز است و برای هر کسی که می خواهد به سرعت یک پل را روی پروتکل Connext بسازد در دسترس است: می توانید آن را در اینجا فورک کنید:
[github.com/CoinHippo-Labs/connext-network-bridge](http://github.com/CoinHippo-Labs/connext-network-bridge)
پشتیبانی بریج
اگر مشکلی با Connext Bridge دارید، با پشتیبانی تماس بگیرید. لطفاً به سرور رسمی Connext Discord بپیوندید و به ✋-bridge-support بروید. این یک لینک دعوت مستقیم است:

توکن NEXT
NEXT توکن شبکه Connext است. این یک ابزار ERC20 و توکن حاکمیتی است که استفاده منصفانه از شبکه را تقویت می کند.
Connext یک بخش حیاتی از زیرساخت عمومی برای وب غیرمتمرکز است و متعلق به جامعه آن است و توسط آن اداره می شود.
بنابراین هدف از توکن NEXT تامین مالی نیست، بلکه در عوض حفظ عدالت عملیاتی برای روترها پس از ارتقای Amarok است.

روترها اپراتورهای گره Connext هستند و NEXT را برای مشارکت در شبکه به اشتراک می گذارند و در ازای آن سهمی از کار را از شبکه به دست می آورند. NEXT با حصول اطمینان از اینکه همه روترها از قوانین یکسانی در مورد سفارش تراکنش منصفانه پیروی می کنند، شبکه را در حال اجرا نگه می دارد و در صورت نقض این قوانین، NEXT روتر کاهش می یابد.

علاوه بر نقش آن به عنوان یک ابزار، NEXT برای اداره خزانه اکوسیستم شبکه Connext از طریق یک DAO استفاده خواهد شد. در انجام این کار، جامعه به عنوان داور بلندمدت تخصیص منابع نسبت به مشارکت کنندگان کلیدی عمل می کند که شبکه Connext را به جلو می راند.
جزییات توکن NEXT:

Ticker: NEXT
Standard: ERC20
Total supply: 1B tokens
Token address on Ethereum: 0xd63014F367aFe2eb006FD3dD6C02110A9dCE42dC

شبکه های پشتیبانی شده:
کانکست به کاربران اجازه میدهد تا دارایی هایشان را به سرعت و ارزان بین بیش از 16 شبکه انتقال دهند. bridge.connext.network
کانکست در حال ساخت شبکه ای با قابلیت میان همکاری بین بلاکچین های مختلف می باشد. در ادامه لیستی از این شبکه ها نشان داده شده است.
شبکه مین نت



کانکست چیست؟
Connext ابزاری برای ساخت برنامه‌های زنجیره‌ای متقابل، مانند بریج ها و سایر برنامه‌های بدون مجوز است. Connext در حال حاضر بیش از 11 زنجیره را به هم متصل می کند - می توانید بریج پرچمدار را در اینجا امتحان کنید: <https://bridge.connext.network>.

برای توضیح دقیق تر Connext، به اینجا نگاه کنید:
<https://wiki.connext.academy/what-is-connext>

آیا کانکس یک صرافی است؟
خیر. Connext پروتکلی است که از بسیاری از ارائه دهندگان نقدینگی/زیرساخت مستقل (به نام روتر) تشکیل شده است که ارتباط بین زنجیره ها را امکان پذیر می کند. توسعه‌دهندگان می‌توانند اپلیکیشن‌های زنجیره‌ای متقاطع مانند DEX را در بالای Connext بسازند.

آیا کانکست به سرمایه هایم دسترسی دارد؟

خیر. نه تیم مؤسس Connext و نه هیچ مسیریابی که پروتکل های Connext را اجرا می کند، هیچ گونه دسترسی به وجوه شما را ندارند. به دلیل نحوه طراحی Connext، امنیت سیستم مانند امنیت بلاک چین است - حتی اگر هر روتر در شبکه ما با یکدیگر تبانی کنند، هیچ راهی برای دسترسی آنها به وجوه شما وجود نخواهد داشت.
آیا برای استفاده از کانکست باید هزینه پرداخت شود؟
زمانی که کاربران تراکنش هایی را ارسال می کنند، هزینه ها توسط روترهای داخل شبکه دریافت می شود. تیم Connext تنها یک پیاده‌کننده پروتکل است و بنابراین هیچ هزینه‌ای دریافت نمی‌کند.

در حال حاضر، تمام کارمزدهای مرتبط با اجرای یک تراکنش زنجیره ای به شرح زیر اخذ می شود:
هزینه روتر: هزینه ای است که اپراتورهای روتر برای تسهیل تراکنش دریافت می کنند. به گونه ای طراحی شده است که بتواند هزینه های گاز روتر را پوشش دهد و انگیزه ای (در حال حاضر 0.05٪ از حجم تراکنش) برای تامین نقدینگی ایجاد کند. هزینه با در نظر گرفتن تفاوت بین آنچه کاربر در زنجیره ارسال می‌گذارد و آنچه روتر در زنجیره مقصد ارائه می‌دهد دریافت می‌شود.
کارمزد زنجیره ارسال: این کارمزد تراکنش در زنجیره ارسال برای شروع یک تراکنش زنجیره ای متقابل است. توسط dapp و ارائه دهنده کیف پول کاربر پیکربندی شده و در دارایی اصلی زنجیره مبدا شارژ می شود.
دریافت کارمزد زنجیره ای: این مبلغ بسته به نحوه ارسال تراکنش پرداخت می شود. اگر کاربر خودش آن را ارسال کند، پس هزینه ها در دارایی اصلی زنجیره دریافت کننده (کارمزد گاز مربوط به هر تراکنش زنجیره ای) است. اگر تراکنش از طریق رله‌ها ارسال شود، هزینه از دارایی دریافتی شما خارج می‌شود (یعنی کارمزد رله USDC از مبلغی که روتر برای شما در زنجیره مقصد قرار داده است کسر می‌شود).

title: The Salve for the Short Crypto Attention Span
body:
*Nobody calls me Lebowski, you got the wrong guy. I’m the Dude, man.*

**Your crypto information diet is lacking long-form, deep, curated thoughts to inform your actions.** 

You get plenty of short-form, fast information in your Twitter feed and Discord groups. However, you are missing slow writing informed through extensive research and intensive thought. 

**The Dude humbly believes he can deliver this service.**

The Dude has one mission, dear reader: *help you make better NFT decisions that provide joy over both the short and long-term.* But show me the incentive, and I will show you the outcome (h/t [Charlie Munger](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hJYLJRr3hEY)). The Dude will attempt to align economic incentives with you. The Dude chose to write on Mirror to eliminate the middleman and directly connect the reader and the Dude. 

\~\~

Who is the Dude? The Dude isn’t ready to doxx himself yet because the Dude has the type of job that might not be as appreciative of [his CryptoDickButt](https://gallery.so/JeffreyLebowski/2BAp5bmiAGsHyhnOqv2SzNaLYBK/2BAnl34mthIAv4gHjP0yUL8jP2f) as he is. 

The Dude can say a few things about himself - the Dude went to college in the United States. Some have said this is a good college. **You can decide for yourself based on this writing if you find the Dude’s critical thinking worthy of that statement.** 

The Dude then joined the military and served in Special Operations. Some have said this is a good Special Operations unit. **You can decide for yourself based on this writing if you find the Dude’s integrity and diligence worthy of that statement.**  

The Dude then went to a graduate business school. Some have said this is a good business school. **You can decide for yourself based on this writing if you find the Dude’s strategies and analysis worthy of that statement.** 

The Dude now works at a professional services company. Some have said this is a good professional services company. **You can decide for yourself based on this writing if you find the Dude's structure and approach worthy of that statement.**

Over the last year, the Dude absorbed thousands of hours of podcasts, read about the history of new technologies, and deciphered the financial markets. The Dude collected accordingly and believes wallets speak for themselves. Here are [the Dude's wallets](https://linktr.ee/jefflebowski). Wallets are transparent scorecards that show personal preference, value accrual, and value destruction. NFT wallets are your tokenized actions. "Don't tell me, show me" is a phrase the Dude often used in the military. 

Applied to crypto: **don't tell me what you think is important to collect, just show me your wallet.**

\~\~

The Dude's posts will only ever come in two forms: **short and long**. 

Short posts will never be more than 500 words. The Dude believes in clear, concise writing. The Dude will attempt to not repeat points. Long posts will be research focused and provide ample data to assist readers in making decisions best for them. 

The Dude may write about market dynamics, interview artists, create fictional “sci-fi” pieces that help contextualize your current decisions, or really write about whatever the Dude wants.

**The Dude hopes you'll join him on this journey.**

title: novel net art thesis(rough draft)
body:
https://soundcloud.com/p-r-i-m-e-c-u-l-t/sets/iudhsgwldoru 

Some of the most beautiful and haunting images ever seen exist in certain corners of the internet. But what exactly is the source? Why do these images speak to our heart and stick in our mind when others don’t? 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GETfJBDB-ZJZ5LTbURjAk.jpg?height=1162&width=1170)

Novel net art has certain characteristics that make it so alluring. Good example of this is everything-at-once drained-out internet-as-a-dream edits that have seen boost in popularity over last 2 years. Its what happens to the liminal space when the liminal space no longer attempts to tether itself to reality.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9yP15NGn6WE682MUSPP6K.jpg?height=1452&width=1170)

Perception: something we do subconsciously, all the time, to everything we look at, no exceptions. To understand why novel net art is unique we must look at what exactly the process of perception is.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6Bt-uRG4NlgxNdNCLFsaU.jpg?height=1448&width=1170)

When we look at something we are used to breaking it down into parts. When we look at a bed we see “pillow” “sheets” “trusty pistol within arms reach” . But before that, there is a moment, a moment before perception when everything is one, a moment of pre-perception Unity before the Scalpel of Reason steps in and cuts and categorizes and identifies everything into neat little digestible elements. God lives in that moment of pre-perception (maybe other more malevolent entities do too, im not sure). In that moment everything is unified, and all rational cognition is downstream from that moment

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/87Ymz3FUHZ4l1AMF1QIYM.jpg?height=1117&width=1170)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rTwQWeIOSc4N9DxeIQE9p.jpg?height=1162&width=1170)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/x4lK35QckkfcWJCRQ2O3-.jpg?height=1168&width=1170)

.Back to avant net art. this art is aesthetically jarring, the distortion and overlapping elements diffuses citation and disorients the viewer. This brief moment of disorientation allows the art to hijack that crucial moment of pre-perception and extend it out so we can swim in it a bit. We look at the art piece and try to go about the usual process of perception but – if the artist is skilled enough – the process is interrupted and we exist in the pre-perception moment for much longer than usual. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ofALCRpQF1iM1LTtMMtOD.jpg?height=1159&width=1170)

This art strikes a chord because we are finally being honest about what the internet really is. Its the abyss, the void, its Heaven, its dreamscape, its what you see when you close your eyes. You don’t see your phone in your dreams because you’re looking through the window, not at it.  We’re finally being honest. When you log on, your psyche enters the realm of the Qliphot, wherein you are at the mercy of its residents.Were finally being honest. This art proves it.  We’re finally being honest.    

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mhm0_hix6nV4At-AYfLli.jpg?height=1161&width=1170)

One day we wont need computers to log on

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VPmm7ntCZCQsBBqWGi0jy.jpg?height=1169&width=1170)

body:
## In Case You Missed It…

The numbers are in for the new Bastard DAO Gnosis Safe signers. Congratulations to the new members. These replacements should greatly help with DAO efficiency. And for the record here are our signers:

* [Berk](https://twitter.com/berkozdemir)
* [888mooncat](https://twitter.com/888Mooncat)
* [Stimpy](https://twitter.com/stimpy0x)
* [Qexd](https://twitter.com/Qexd)
* [Rosco](https://twitter.com/RoscoKalis)
* [Snooplion](https://twitter.com/snooplion21)
* [DirtbagLu](https://twitter.com/0x8e74)
* [Crypto Texan](https://twitter.com/Crypto_Texan)
* [Wassoshi](https://twitter.com/wassos)

With a huge community effort Bastard GAN Punks V2 won FloorDAO’s Emerging Collection vote! I want to give a shout out to Justin Avery, Sheep, Infamous, Wassoshi, JU7URNA, Qexd, bgans.eth, Juicy, Rooster, Printer Punk, Rosco Kalis, sexas, notsofast, the multisig signers, all the blockchain sleuths, the bribers, and the voters big and small. Thank you everyone who made this victory a reality. We won with a record breaking 60% of the votes. And but since this win, the community has grown, there’s been an increased interest in collaborations, and BGAN sales volume, and Discord scam bots has increased drastically. As market conditions turn, we’ll very likely see increased liquidity from FloorDAO. But, this win also means being represented next to CryptoPunks, Wizards, and Squiggles by another DAO, which adds legitimacy to our community as well as the BGAN collection. So congratulations delusional Bastards.

[https://twitter.com/FloorDAO/status/1534670588693708800?s=20&t=eyJx59_E3d8hlKlz-PMifA](https://twitter.com/FloorDAO/status/1534670588693708800?s=20&t=eyJx59_E3d8hlKlz-PMifA)

Berk has been busy finding new uses for $BASTARD while simultaneously breaking NFTs. Their contract lets people mint a copy of any NFT in Berk’s wallet. Soon after the release Berk noted that only the art works that they created are being copied. It’s a weird experiment for sure, but it’s proven (temporarily) bullish for [$BASTARD price action](https://www.dextools.io/app/ether/pair-explorer/0xd97310a6be1c7cefac6d26eeba073c39e7573423). Keep it up, Berk.

[https://twitter.com/berkozdemir/status/1528012410233159681?s=20&t=jTIUBDNGYj0FE_05IagHew](https://twitter.com/berkozdemir/status/1528012410233159681?s=20&t=jTIUBDNGYj0FE_05IagHew)

In the Discord there have been some friendly debates on traits and whether or not specific Bastards are mislabeled. And some interesting points came up. Wassoshi shared the [BGAN V2 TRAIT CONSTITUTION](https://bgansv2.notion.site/bgansv2/BGAN-V2-TRAIT-CONSTITUTION-36a7a8be7786482593f38f59cad07beb). This is a living document instructing the community on how to propose a trait change, along with a detailed description of every existing trait, and a list of each Bastard who’s undergone a trait change. Snooplin also makes the point that we should aim to “improve the metadata with or without the owners involvement. And we also want to improve \[trait\] definition so they are clearer.” So if you’ve been looking for a way to get involved with the Bastard DAO, look no further.

Speaking of Constitutions, there is also a [BGAN V2 DAO CONSTITUTION](https://bgansv2.notion.site/bgansv2/BGAN-V2-DAO-CONSTITUTION-b3d561697275472ea7ab9b39239bb212) which defines a valid Bastard DAO proposal. But it doesn’t cover the social etiquette that is expected when submitting a new proposal--especially one that calls for Treasury spending. So, if you have an idea that could benefit the DAO please do write a thorough proposal outlining the pros and cons, but before publishing it to Snapshot share it with the community and accept their feedback.

Our friend [Justin Avery](https://twitter.com/justinavery) over at NFTX also wrote a guide introducing the $BGAN Vault and how to use it. Inside there are strategies for increasing your $BGAN stack. Who knows, Anon, maybe one day you’ll be a BGAN whale.

[https://academy.nftx.io/bgan-punks/](https://academy.nftx.io/bgan-punks/)

888mooncat has continued to sound the horn for community members to to create BGAN content. In the last couple of months community involvement has increased, but there are still a few roles that need filling. And probably some roles we didn’t know we needed. Web3 is very creator centric, [Mirror](https://twitter.com/viamirror) has introduced Writing NFTs as a way to incentivize content creation.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/o1ztY3OC7w6JgUqEC51Zc.png?height=836&width=1196)

In the Ecosystem of Expertise channel in the BGAN’s [Discord](https://discord.gg/NsvBjrGX) Snarflakes highlights some of the more basic ways to contribute and grow the Bastard community. Some of which are paid roles.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zX0XdI7QmTY0dDMcGJggd.png?height=318&width=1148)

888Mooncat has also blessed us with their [Letter 3 - Detailed Guide to Bastard Gan Punk V2 NFT art collection](https://888mooncat.substack.com/p/introduction-to-bastard-gan-punk?s=w). The article touches on everything from how GAN (Generative Adversarial Networks) works to a history of the BGAN collection with their own philosophies mixed in.

[https://twitter.com/bganpunks/status/1540479466538995712?s=20&t=MJeA4nINtPbzZycM-rmk6Q](https://twitter.com/bganpunks/status/1540479466538995712?s=20&t=MJeA4nINtPbzZycM-rmk6Q)

HIDE YOUR HOODIES! BGANs with the HOODIE trait are experiencing a price discovery period as they start finding their fair market value. Surly, if any of these large bids are accepted it could signal an elevation in the fair price of the entire BGAN collection. This is something we’ve already started to witness with Infamous’ 6 ETH HOODIE buy. This may also signal more grail listings and sales as well. 

[https://twitter.com/infamousXBT/status/1541308658000224256?s=20&t=RLh2hikgZEFOFzkiKVV64Q](https://twitter.com/infamousXBT/status/1541308658000224256?s=20&t=RLh2hikgZEFOFzkiKVV64Q)

LET BIDDING SZN COMMENCE! Buying NFTs with common traits is what you do when you’re just testing the vibe of a community, or if you have a short time horizon. Which is still important and necessary for growth. But when rarer traits start selling, it signals staying power as people who believe in the collection’s future start hunting for their holy grail. In the days leading up to the FoorDAO vote there were a handful of HYPE AF sales including a floaty head acquired by [BTCLONE](https://twitter.com/eumarius). We’ve also seen a massive increase in sales volume thanks to big ticket buyers like [Infamous](https://twitter.com/infamousXBT) who recently added a HOODIE to their collection.

[https://twitter.com/muiyfree/status/1530856373877059585?s=20&t=8JkoZfArewjIn-QDIws7FQ](https://twitter.com/muiyfree/status/1530856373877059585?s=20&t=8JkoZfArewjIn-QDIws7FQ)

We’ve started see a new narrative emerge for BGAN Punks. There has been a move away from being labeled as a Crypto Punks derivative project for some time now, but some community members are pushing it further and identifying BGANS as art transcending the PFP genre of NFTs. This change of narrative will only benefit the community and should continue to be reenforced. Some other emerging points on this initiative are labeling BGANs the most successful AI generated art collection, and the standard BGAN Punks set for glitch art.

[https://twitter.com/segwitnitwit/status/1530635992692150275?s=20&t=8JkoZfArewjIn-QDIws7FQ](https://twitter.com/segwitnitwit/status/1530635992692150275?s=20&t=8JkoZfArewjIn-QDIws7FQ)

[https://dirtbaglu.medium.com/bgan-punks-transformative-not-derivative-40cd2847a0c8](https://dirtbaglu.medium.com/bgan-punks-transformative-not-derivative-40cd2847a0c8)

There is another partnership with UASIS CORP. 100 Bastards were given a Special Edition Osiris One ship which in the future is playable in Voxel, Sandbox, and Decentraland. But until that day comes, they sure are nice to look at! Follow the direction in the tweet below, they’re free to mint (just pay gas), and available to first 100 Bastards.

[https://twitter.com/bganpunks/status/1537481439373041664?s=20&t=ofYmPGXt57eW3Mu86wi6aA](https://twitter.com/bganpunks/status/1537481439373041664?s=20&t=ofYmPGXt57eW3Mu86wi6aA)

Perama in the Discord has shared their GACTANS realistic bastard bastards project. Read more about it [here](https://perama-v.github.io/ethereum/gactans). And the link to play with your favorite bgans is [here](https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmV7vA888YVzmhL2epitCobSZxSFSAjTaa1r5CWqe5YM2k/gactans/360_double.jpg) (just replace the number 360).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Q21bQOhIhIJajmsZ8ypAC.png?height=1900&width=1224)

The Museum of Crypto Art is a public good and the “first cultural institution of crypto art.” Their mission is to challenge the traditional museum’s curation process, which is generally decided by board members, wealthy donors, and other elites. Their [Permanent Collection](https://app.museumofcryptoart.com/collection/the-permanent-collection) is all works that predate December 2020--BGANs barely missed the cut here. The [Community Collection](https://app.museumofcryptoart.com/collection/community-collection) is more than 6,000 NFTs shared by the NFT community as a whole. It’s a place where anyone can share and discover art, and it’s regularly shared in IRL art exhibits (read more about their Collections [here](https://museumofcrypto.notion.site/M-C-Art-Collections-17fedaf714674e748539ea19cce6b19c)). And now BGANs are represented in the Community Collection. The goal is to further encourage the BGAN Community to share their BGANs with the world, and for BGANs to have further representation in large collections, museums, and eventually exclusive curated collections.

[https://twitter.com/0x8e74/status/1540815914282545152?s=20&t=0wW2X9nLIxw2QugWsoknqw](https://twitter.com/0x8e74/status/1540815914282545152?s=20&t=0wW2X9nLIxw2QugWsoknqw)

## Bastard of the Month:

[Segwitnitwit](https://twitter.com/segwitnitwit) is a BGAN meme lord whose work is definitely worth following. He won BotM for his contributions in constantly making the world beautiful. His [BGAN Exploder](https://segwitnitwit.github.io/?id=3104&fr=24) stemmed from his interest in cellular automata, and has blessed our timelines for some time. Segwit says he’s fine tuning and experimenting with other cool functions and utility he can add. And he’s hoping to present it as a stand alone NFT collection in the future that may be purchased with $BASTARD. When he’s not exploding Bastards, he enjoys watching American football, playing with his four cats, and hiking with his girlfriend.

[https://foundation.app/@segwitnitwit/comm/1](https://foundation.app/@segwitnitwit/comm/1)

Segwitnitwit has been in the crypto space since 2017 when his college roommate started mining Ether. His origin story rings familiar for many of us here:

> “Longstory short, my roommate introduced me, the money drew me in and confounded me, the tech kept me around. And the "why does anything have value" nihilistic rabbit hole kept me awake.”

But now Segwit is sticking around for the tech and the community. The Merger to PoS is something he’s been looking forward to since 2017, and it’s just around the corner.

> “As cliche as it is, the tech. I am terribly excited right now to see all the developments that are occurring and all the crazy shit that is about to \[happen\]. The merge to POS is something i’ve been excited about since fucking 2017. They’ve been talking about it FOREVER. Like what if it succeeds without a hitch?! What if it crashes and burns?? Definitely interested in that.
>
> Also current market conditions. In 2017/2018 the run up drew me in deep, I was all about crypto. Then everything when to shit and I was at like 95% losses. I was overwhelmed and pretty beaten down. I left the scene entirely. MISSING FUCKING CRYPTOPUNKS UGHHHHH!! I could have gotten those for free, but I left the scene. RIP. So basically I’m not doing that again. I feel pretty numb to the current losses. Also I sold a good chunk of my ETH around $4,200. And managed to put a down payment on a house with it! So I’m super happy with where I’m at. Just going to wait until I get more cash & prices keep dipping. Going to load up on some ETH.
>
> And most importantly NFTs. To me NFTs have provided common interests among people thats more than just, "we all hope the same coin goes up in value." Early on trading just crypto got me down. It was kind of lonely, I didn’t have anyone in my life to talk about it to. I mean I talked to every living soul I could about it, but no one ever knew wtf I was talking about. No lie, the BGAN community is a huge part of why I’m still here. It's fun to see what crazy deals are coming on the market, and how people are choosing to spend their ETH. Learning about everyone's preferences. Love seeing people snagging bangers for great prices. And of course I’m a part of a few other communities that keep me engaged, but mainly BGANs.”

Thank you for sharing your life with us briefly, and congratulations on the new home.

title: Tokenomics for Milady Community Token: A Proposal
body:
I present the following as a proposal for the Tokenomics of the Milady Community Token, which was introduced earlier today and raised $40k seed funding in under an hour.

Despite this early enthusiasm, some questions did arise about the usability of the token, specifically the level of integration with the overall mission of the Remilia Collective and the creation of “use cases.”  As such, I provide this document as a proposal for the Tokenomics of the Milady Community Token.

**Authors Note**: I am generally unfamiliar with the world of finance, blockchain, and crypto in general, so I spent over 25 minutes reviewing other Tokenomics papers to gather ideas.  I was especially interested in a coin called Terra and Luna, which had some really exciting ideas that spurred my imagination and showed me the true power of the blockchain.  While I still don’t understand everything, I think I’ve read enough to know that if you want to be successful, you’re going to have to set yourself apart.

To that end, I offer this proposal (and please note it is just a proposal, I have no formal relationship with the Milady Community Token or its founders) as a means to set this token apart.  WAY apart.

Alright, here we go:

### Milady Community Token

Tokenomics Proposal 
 27 Jun 2022 
 Roderick Früht

It’s morning in America, and what was once a thriving nation of entrepreneurs, engineers, and fanatics has now receded into a blind hypnotized submission.  The dairy cows are no longer being milked, there are no dairy cows at all.  Imagine now, you are on a farm.  Imagine now, if you will, wind chimes gently clanging against one another singing their mournful song, pan now with the camera of your mind past a rocking chair in a ghostly perpetual motion on the front porch.

Now through the front door our mind camera goes, gazing upon the dusty furniture not sat upon in years, a curled edge of a picture frame so muted by time the faces have become blurred thumbprints, and finally now into the kitchen.  Amidst all of the atrophy and rust, there is a pristine table with four plates, perfectly set, untouched by time.  

> The words on the screen appear: “We invite you to sit.”

> Fade to Black

> Now appears before you on the movie screen of your mind:

> “Milady Community Token: A Story of Trust”

Let us now enter **The Tokenomics Zone**.


---

The usage of the Milady Community Token can be summed up in one word: *interesting*.

What if we did the one thing with this token that no one else in the business was willing to do?  What if we pulled back the veil and told you the one Oedipal truth that always hides behind mommy whenever someone comes asking?  

**What if we told you that there was absolutely no purpose to this token?**

What would happen if we told you that?  Would you *freak out*?  

> Fade to black

> Words appear on screen: “Don’t Freak Out.”

> An orbicular golden image beings to materialize, it is the Milady Community Token, spinning in a an *angelic* perpetual motion (to stand in thematic contrast to the rocking chair from before).

I mean sure, it would probably behoove us to pretend that there was some reason for making this coin.  Or that there is some big “prize” for buying it.  We might even want to insinuate that holding this token will allow you to have some “special level of access” to the Milady community - VIP rooms, one-to-one’s with Charlotte, a free subscription to Seed Oil Streaming+, all manner of special features and add-ons for your Milady pfp, etc., etc.  But the truth is that **none of that is going to happen**.  And we’re sort of tired of even suggesting that.

Let’s try something different.  Let’s try throwing away everything about a normal Tokenomics document - the staking, the project contributions, the exchange of value - let’s throw away all that bullshit for just a few.

Now imagine instead that we just embraced the fact that this token had **no value**.  And now let’s embrace the fact that this token has **unlimited value**.  What would that look like?  I’m not talking about a mindset, I’m talking about a way in which we could truly demonstrate a commitment to a value-less token while at the same time running up the fucking score on its price.  How could we do this?

Well that comes down to whether or not you actually believe in 

A. Network Spirituality

Buying this token is an act of faith.  It is the ultimate “field of dreams.”  You must actually believe that “if you buy, it will come.”  If you do not believe this, then do not buy the token.

B. Post-Authorship

If you buy this token, you must submit to the idea that you are not buying it for yourself.

What does this mean?

> Fade to black

> Words appear on screen: “What does this mean?”

What if we used this token to standardize a sort of *financial* pseudonymity?  What if we used this token to harness chaos into something beautiful?  What if we could make this token *more meaningful* by *fully embracing its meaninglessness*?  

At this point you’re probably worried that I am teetering on the brink of some real “mumbo-jumbo.”  Have no fear, I’m about to make this dream very real.  Allow to me to introduce the most radical feature of the Milady Community Token:

**Payments with the Milady Community Token will never go to the intended recipient.**  

…Instead, they will go to a random Milady.    
  
 Let me say that again: if you, the Milady buyer (person A), purchases a $295 Balenciaga hat from a Milady seller (person B), at the point of submitting/processing that payment, the money will go to another randomly generated Milady wallet (person C) not involved in the original transaction.

> Fade to black

> Words appear on screen: He said whaaaaat?

Now you may scoff at what I’ve just said.  You may wonder why anyone would ever purchase anything with this arrangement.  You might laugh at the mere *suggestion* of it.  You might say, “who would be stupid enough to accept a payment that won’t even go to them?” 

But let me ask you this question instead: “who would be stupid enough to *not* use a token that would randomly pay them multiple times a day for doing absolutely nothing at all?”

How would this financial system be maintained?  Wouldn’t there need to be a constant cycle of purchasing to sustain an enclosed economy such as this?  

Yes there would.  

Well who the hell would buy into any economy in which money is not appropriately transferred from a buyer to an intended seller? (you may ask)

To answer this question, I direct you to research the history of the Milady and its consistent anti-fragility in the face of chaos.


---

The Milady Community Token is a mathematical representation of Network Spirituality that can be monitored in real-time.  It shows the movement not only of our desires, but also of our love.  We buy into it freely, like throwing coins into a wishing well that we can only *wish* to get back.  Meanwhile, the token encounters the next rung of pseudonymity: letting go of the authorship of our purchases and our money.  Where our money emerges from and where it goes is not something that we should be personalizing anymore.  It’s really not up to us.  The more we can give ourselves over to this notion, the more the Network will break through the dark soil and grow upward toward the sun  We water this token the way that we water our plants on the windowsill.

But windowsill plants can be fussy.  Sometimes they need more water, sometimes less.  Sometimes they whither for no reason, sometimes they have to fight a little just to prove that to themselves that they can survive.  Sometimes they need to feel the sun on their face, sometimes they need to hide away from the sun altogether while they remember who they are: just a plant.  just nobody at all.  just happy to be alive.

If that last paragraph seems like a joke to you, I urge you to NOT buy Milady Community Tokens.


---

This project raised $40,000 in 40 minutes.  It wasn’t even difficult.  It had milady stamped on it and so nothing more was needed.  Think of how much power could be unleashed in 40 hours, or days, or years?  Unlimited.  We feed this power with the token.  We love the token.  We need the token.  We give away the token.  We are happy to find it again.  We are happy to give it away again.  It’s all good.

Unfortunately that’s all that can be said before veering into the territory of bullshit.  Thank you for considering your purchase of the Milady Community Token


---

*Disclaimer: this was a work of speculative fiction and in no way represents a real financial plan.  Right?  Right.  …Right.  Right.  Right?*

body:
## In Case You Missed It…

The numbers are in for the new Bastard DAO Gnosis Safe signers. Congratulations to the new members. These replacements should greatly help with DAO efficiency. And for the record here are our signers:

* [Berk](https://twitter.com/berkozdemir)
* [888mooncat](https://twitter.com/888Mooncat)
* [Stimpy](https://twitter.com/stimpy0x)
* [Qexd](https://twitter.com/Qexd)
* [Rosco](https://twitter.com/RoscoKalis)
* [Snooplion](https://twitter.com/snooplion21)
* [DirtbagLu](https://twitter.com/0x8e74)
* [Crypto Texan](https://twitter.com/Crypto_Texan)
* [Wassoshi](https://twitter.com/wassos)

With a huge community effort Bastard GAN Punks V2 won FloorDAO’s Emerging Collection vote! I want to give a shout out to Justin Avery, Sheep, Infamous, Wassoshi, JU7URNA, Qexd, bgans.eth, Juicy, Rooster, Printer Punk, Rosco Kalis, sexas, notsofast, the multisig signers, all the blockchain sleuths, the bribers, and the voters big and small. Thank you everyone who made this victory a reality. We won with a record breaking 60% of the votes. And but since this win, the community has grown, there’s been an increased interest in collaborations, and BGAN sales volume, and Discord scam bots has increased drastically. As market conditions turn, we’ll very likely see increased liquidity from FloorDAO. But, this win also means being represented next to CryptoPunks, Wizards, and Squiggles by another DAO, which adds legitimacy to our community as well as the BGAN collection. So congratulations delusional Bastards.

[https://twitter.com/FloorDAO/status/1534670588693708800?s=20&t=eyJx59_E3d8hlKlz-PMifA](https://twitter.com/FloorDAO/status/1534670588693708800?s=20&t=eyJx59_E3d8hlKlz-PMifA)

Berk has been busy finding new uses for $BASTARD while simultaneously breaking NFTs. Their contract lets people mint a copy of any NFT in Berk’s wallet. Soon after the release Berk noted that only the art works that they created are being copied. It’s a weird experiment for sure, but it’s proven (temporarily) bullish for [$BASTARD price action](https://www.dextools.io/app/ether/pair-explorer/0xd97310a6be1c7cefac6d26eeba073c39e7573423). Keep it up, Berk.

[https://twitter.com/berkozdemir/status/1528012410233159681?s=20&t=jTIUBDNGYj0FE_05IagHew](https://twitter.com/berkozdemir/status/1528012410233159681?s=20&t=jTIUBDNGYj0FE_05IagHew)

In the Discord there have been some friendly debates on traits and whether or not specific Bastards are mislabeled. And some interesting points came up. Wassoshi shared the [BGAN V2 TRAIT CONSTITUTION](https://bgansv2.notion.site/bgansv2/BGAN-V2-TRAIT-CONSTITUTION-36a7a8be7786482593f38f59cad07beb). This is a living document instructing the community on how to propose a trait change, along with a detailed description of every existing trait, and a list of each Bastard who’s undergone a trait change. Snooplin also makes the point that we should aim to “improve the metadata with or without the owners involvement. And we also want to improve \[trait\] definition so they are clearer.” So if you’ve been looking for a way to get involved with the Bastard DAO, look no further.

Speaking of Constitutions, there is also a [BGAN V2 DAO CONSTITUTION](https://bgansv2.notion.site/bgansv2/BGAN-V2-DAO-CONSTITUTION-b3d561697275472ea7ab9b39239bb212) which defines a valid Bastard DAO proposal. But it doesn’t cover the social etiquette that is expected when submitting a new proposal--especially one that calls for Treasury spending. So, if you have an idea that could benefit the DAO please do write a thorough proposal outlining the pros and cons, but before publishing it to Snapshot share it with the community and accept their feedback.

Our friend [Justin Avery](https://twitter.com/justinavery) over at NFTX also wrote a guide introducing the $BGAN Vault and how to use it. Inside there are strategies for increasing your $BGAN stack. Who knows, Anon, maybe one day you’ll be a BGAN whale.

[https://academy.nftx.io/bgan-punks/](https://academy.nftx.io/bgan-punks/)

888mooncat has continued to sound the horn for community members to to create BGAN content. In the last couple of months community involvement has increased, but there are still a few roles that need filling. And probably some roles we didn’t know we needed. Web3 is very creator centric, [Mirror](https://twitter.com/viamirror) has introduced Writing NFTs as a way to incentivize content creation.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/o1ztY3OC7w6JgUqEC51Zc.png?height=836&width=1196)

In the Ecosystem of Expertise channel in the BGAN’s [Discord](https://discord.gg/NsvBjrGX) Snarflakes highlights some of the more basic ways to contribute and grow the Bastard community. Some of which are paid roles.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zX0XdI7QmTY0dDMcGJggd.png?height=318&width=1148)

888Mooncat has also blessed us with their [Letter 3 - Detailed Guide to Bastard Gan Punk V2 NFT art collection](https://888mooncat.substack.com/p/introduction-to-bastard-gan-punk?s=w). The article touches on everything from how GAN (Generative Adversarial Networks) works to a history of the BGAN collection with their own philosophies mixed in.

[https://twitter.com/bganpunks/status/1540479466538995712?s=20&t=MJeA4nINtPbzZycM-rmk6Q](https://twitter.com/bganpunks/status/1540479466538995712?s=20&t=MJeA4nINtPbzZycM-rmk6Q)

HIDE YOUR HOODIES! BGANs with the HOODIE trait are experiencing a price discovery period as they start finding their fair market value. Surly, if any of these large bids are accepted it could signal an elevation in the fair price of the entire BGAN collection. This is something we’ve already started to witness with Infamous’ 6 ETH HOODIE buy. This may also signal more grail listings and sales as well. 

[https://twitter.com/infamousXBT/status/1541308658000224256?s=20&t=RLh2hikgZEFOFzkiKVV64Q](https://twitter.com/infamousXBT/status/1541308658000224256?s=20&t=RLh2hikgZEFOFzkiKVV64Q)

LET BIDDING SZN COMMENCE! Buying NFTs with common traits is what you do when you’re just testing the vibe of a community, or if you have a short time horizon. Which is still important and necessary for growth. But when rarer traits start selling, it signals staying power as people who believe in the collection’s future start hunting for their holy grail. In the days leading up to the FoorDAO vote there were a handful of HYPE AF sales including a floaty head acquired by [BTCLONE](https://twitter.com/eumarius). We’ve also seen a massive increase in sales volume thanks to big ticket buyers like [Infamous](https://twitter.com/infamousXBT) who recently added a HOODIE to their collection.

[https://twitter.com/muiyfree/status/1530856373877059585?s=20&t=8JkoZfArewjIn-QDIws7FQ](https://twitter.com/muiyfree/status/1530856373877059585?s=20&t=8JkoZfArewjIn-QDIws7FQ)

We’ve started see a new narrative emerge for BGAN Punks. There has been a move away from being labeled as a Crypto Punks derivative project for some time now, but some community members are pushing it further and identifying BGANS as art transcending the PFP genre of NFTs. This change of narrative will only benefit the community and should continue to be reenforced. Some other emerging points on this initiative are labeling BGANs the most successful AI generated art collection, and the standard BGAN Punks set for glitch art.

[https://twitter.com/segwitnitwit/status/1530635992692150275?s=20&t=8JkoZfArewjIn-QDIws7FQ](https://twitter.com/segwitnitwit/status/1530635992692150275?s=20&t=8JkoZfArewjIn-QDIws7FQ)

[https://dirtbaglu.medium.com/bgan-punks-transformative-not-derivative-40cd2847a0c8](https://dirtbaglu.medium.com/bgan-punks-transformative-not-derivative-40cd2847a0c8)

There is another partnership with UASIS CORP. 100 Bastards were given a Special Edition Osiris One ship which in the future is playable in Voxel, Sandbox, and Decentraland. But until that day comes, they sure are nice to look at! Follow the direction in the tweet below, they’re free to mint (just pay gas), and available to first 100 Bastards.

[https://twitter.com/bganpunks/status/1537481439373041664?s=20&t=ofYmPGXt57eW3Mu86wi6aA](https://twitter.com/bganpunks/status/1537481439373041664?s=20&t=ofYmPGXt57eW3Mu86wi6aA)

Perama in the Discord has shared their GACTANS realistic bastard bastards project. Read more about it [here](https://perama-v.github.io/ethereum/gactans). And the link to play with your favorite bgans is [here](https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmV7vA888YVzmhL2epitCobSZxSFSAjTaa1r5CWqe5YM2k/gactans/360_double.jpg) (just replace the number 360).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Q21bQOhIhIJajmsZ8ypAC.png?height=1900&width=1224)

The Museum of Crypto Art is a public good and the “first cultural institution of crypto art.” Their mission is to challenge the traditional museum’s curation process, which is generally decided by board members, wealthy donors, and other elites. Their [Permanent Collection](https://app.museumofcryptoart.com/collection/the-permanent-collection) is all works that predate December 2020--BGANs barely missed the cut here. The [Community Collection](https://app.museumofcryptoart.com/collection/community-collection) is more than 6,000 NFTs shared by the NFT community as a whole. It’s a place where anyone can share and discover art, and it’s regularly shared in IRL art exhibits (read more about their Collections [here](https://museumofcrypto.notion.site/M-C-Art-Collections-17fedaf714674e748539ea19cce6b19c)). And now BGANs are represented in the Community Collection. The goal is to further encourage the BGAN Community to share their BGANs with the world, and for BGANs to have further representation in large collections, museums, and eventually exclusive curated collections.

[https://twitter.com/0x8e74/status/1540815914282545152?s=20&t=0wW2X9nLIxw2QugWsoknqw](https://twitter.com/0x8e74/status/1540815914282545152?s=20&t=0wW2X9nLIxw2QugWsoknqw)

## Bastard of the Month:

[Segwitnitwit](https://twitter.com/segwitnitwit) is a BGAN meme lord whose work is definitely worth following. He won BotM for his contributions in constantly making the world beautiful. His [BGAN Exploder](https://segwitnitwit.github.io/?id=3104&fr=24) stemmed from his interest in cellular automata, and has blessed our timelines for some time. Segwit says he’s fine tuning and experimenting with other cool functions and utility he can add. And he’s hoping to present it as a stand alone NFT collection in the future that may be purchased with $BASTARD. When he’s not exploding Bastards, he enjoys watching American football, playing with his four cats, and hiking with his girlfriend.

[https://foundation.app/@segwitnitwit/comm/1](https://foundation.app/@segwitnitwit/comm/1)

Segwitnitwit has been in the crypto space since 2017 when his college roommate started mining Ether. His origin story rings familiar for many of us here:

> “Longstory short, my roommate introduced me, the money drew me in and confounded me, the tech kept me around. And the "why does anything have value" nihilistic rabbit hole kept me awake.”

But now Segwit is sticking around for the tech and the community. The Merger to PoS is something he’s been looking forward to since 2017, and it’s just around the corner.

> “As cliche as it is, the tech. I am terribly excited right now to see all the developments that are occurring and all the crazy shit that is about to \[happen\]. The merge to POS is something i’ve been excited about since fucking 2017. They’ve been talking about it FOREVER. Like what if it succeeds without a hitch?! What if it crashes and burns?? Definitely interested in that.
>
> Also current market conditions. In 2017/2018 the run up drew me in deep, I was all about crypto. Then everything when to shit and I was at like 95% losses. I was overwhelmed and pretty beaten down. I left the scene entirely. MISSING FUCKING CRYPTOPUNKS UGHHHHH!! I could have gotten those for free, but I left the scene. RIP. So basically I’m not doing that again. I feel pretty numb to the current losses. Also I sold a good chunk of my ETH around $4,200. And managed to put a down payment on a house with it! So I’m super happy with where I’m at. Just going to wait until I get more cash & prices keep dipping. Going to load up on some ETH.
>
> And most importantly NFTs. To me NFTs have provided common interests among people thats more than just, "we all hope the same coin goes up in value." Early on trading just crypto got me down. It was kind of lonely, I didn’t have anyone in my life to talk about it to. I mean I talked to every living soul I could about it, but no one ever knew wtf I was talking about. No lie, the BGAN community is a huge part of why I’m still here. It's fun to see what crazy deals are coming on the market, and how people are choosing to spend their ETH. Learning about everyone's preferences. Love seeing people snagging bangers for great prices. And of course I’m a part of a few other communities that keep me engaged, but mainly BGANs.”

Thank you for sharing your life with us briefly, and congratulations on the new home.

title: Oldsters (20+) Guide to Joining a DAO
body:
**This describes how people of advanced age (in the crypto world, this means anyone over 20), can join Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs).** It is based on my experience in advisory and leadership at a number of DAOs over the last 12 months (Bankless DAO, Dorg, Swan DAO and Olympus).

* **What is a DAO?** A DAO is an internet community with a member-managed bank account. DAOs create currencies ([MakerDAO](https://makerdao.com/en/)), collect art ([PleasrDAO](https://pleasr.org/)) and save the planet ([KlimaDAO](https://www.klimadao.finance/)).
* **Why are DAOs anonymous?** Most DAO members do not use their real names. This helps ensure that people are valued for their contributions, not just their pedigrees. Make up a cool name (mine is TwoEggs) and you are halfway to DAO stardom!
* **How do DAO members communicate?** Almost all DAOs communicate using the Discord app, which has features similar to Slack and Zoom. Joining the DAO requires getting an invitation to their Discord server ([here is an invite to KlimaDAO](https://discord.com/invite/klimadao)).
* **How do I verify myself?** DAOs often require a verification process before you can interact with the community. For example, you may need to agree to a set of rules or associate a crypto wallet with your identity using a tool like [collab.land](https://collab.land/).
* **How are DAOs organized?** Once you are verified, you can see the channel topics for that DAO. The left column on Discord shows you a set of channels, usually organized by team. The right column on Discord shows a list of roles - often humorous, like “Head Honchos.”
* **What help do DAOs need?** All DAOs are desperate for UX and smart contract devs, but also for product management, sales, marketing, accounting, HR, writing and social media skills.
* **How do I introduce myself?** Most DAOs have a “start-here” channel with instructions on how to get involved as well as an “introduce-yourself” channel to make yourself known. In your intro, focus on the skills and interests that you think are most important to that DAO.
* **How do I pick a team?** DAOs operate on a “learn by doing” model. Explore the Discord channels until you discover a team you can help. Find out when they have team meetings and sit in. Get to know one or more team leaders and ask what work they need done.
* **How do I contribute?** Find a simple task that a team leader wants done and do it. Good teams are also good at coming up with initial tasks for newcomers. Make sure your task has sponsorship and visibility - random acts of work don’t help!
* **How do I level up?** Do good work for one leader on one team to build a reputation. Get introduced to other teams by people who can vouch for you.
* **What is a reasonable DAO onboarding timeline?** If you have relevant technical or business experience, you should be fully on-boarded to a DAO within 4-6 weeks. This includes: 1-2 weeks exploring DAO channels and joining team meetings; 1-2 weeks to connect with a team leader and deliver an initial task; 2-3 weeks on additional tasks and networking to other teams.
* **How are DAOs governed?** DAOs have very flexible operating models - generally anyone can make a proposal to do anything and if they get the votes that becomes law. Generally DAO members get one vote for each DAO token they hold. This allows for rapid iteration and experimentation but can be a poor substitute for an actual strategy.
* **What is unusual about working with DAOs?** Anonymity is a good way to level the field but is lonely and can allow shockingly bad individual behavior without accountability. Lofty statements about inclusivity can be undermined by back-channel decision processes. Business experience and skill level is often in short supply, with the result that many tasks that are easy for companies are hard for DAOs, including on-boarding, training, compensation, and strategy.
* **What is cool about working with DAOs?** Most people in DAOs are trying to get experience and have fun. The atmosphere is relaxed and the pace is exciting. Many  members are idealistic and committed to making the world a better place.

title: We change with our inputs
body:
For all the technological progress we’ve made as humans over time, psychologically, the pursuit of happiness and peace is still challenging for most of us. That’s clear if we look at our behavior closely. We tend to regret the past or worry about the next thing rather than focus on what’s in front of us. And with our attention always on what’s next, we aren’t present for the thing in front of us or the next thing, because the next thing becomes what’s in front of us when we replace it with what follows. This perpetual striving starts early in our lives. We learn about important people that left their mark on history and we want to be like them so we begin to measure ourselves in relation to others and we create goals that will help us become successful. And once we reach these goals, then we will reward ourselves with peace and happiness. The common prescription for this is to “love the journey.” Loving the journey is great, but not when it’s a rat race. When ambition becomes our condition and not something we can control, in most cases it’s difficult to achieve the outcomes we want. And when we give all of our attention to a moving target, eventually there’s nothing left to sustain our health, relationships, and effectiveness in any pursuit.

But in our society people need to produce. Until they crash at least. The pandemic was that crash for a lot of people. It gave those out of work time to reflect and think harder about what they wanted to spend their time doing. And all the self-help content they could dream of was there waiting for them on the internet if they looked for it. I saw ancient philosophy make a comeback through wisdom synthesizers like Ryan Holiday and *The Daily Stoic*. I spent my days living in a pocket of Twitter inhabited by entrepreneurs, authors, life and business coaches, therapists, and other forms of guides that carved out their own chunk of the creator economy with their bites of wisdom, iconic quotes, guides, and courses. After a year of doing all the things everyone said to do like meditate, journal, and read a bunch of books, I started to zoom out and think about the problem these people were tackling - *how to help others help themselves.* But instead of pretending to be a guru that has all the answers, I started curating twitter lists and automating my favorite tweets into posts on instagram and in a channel in the North Star discord.

I first wanted to make it easier for people to find guides and content I’d vetted already. And I didn’t want to push any one thing. Moving forward, my [newsletter](https://nstar.substack.com) will curate these things and I’ll be using this blog to dig deeper into the questions we I think we should ask ourselves more often if we want to help ourselves live happier lives.

title: Lessons and tales from a 4000 mile bike ride
body:
There are a few events in life that upend your understanding of the world and your place in it. Last summer was one such event. As part of Texas 4000 for Cancer, my teammates and I embarked on the world’s longest annual charity bike ride--4000 miles in 70 days to raise money for cancer research. Over the course of 16 states, 6 National Parks, 20 campsites, and countless different church floors, basements, YMCAs, and homes, we saw a side of America that I wish everyone could see. Why did I do this? It started off as a way to honor my mom’s battle with cancer (you can read more about it [here](https://www.texas4000.org/rider/2021/ozarks/shoumik-dabir/)) but became something so much bigger. It’s been a year since the ride and articulating the enormity of this experience remains an impossible task. But it’s worth sharing some snippets and lessons.

![Some major stops on our journey: Austin, Houston, New Orleans, Little Rock, St. Louis, Chicago, Madison, Minneapolis, Jackson, Salt Lake City, Flagstaff, Albuquerque, Dallas. One giant loop around the country. ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qfJ0eL8eR4Cz-ZEW21mLL.png?height=882&width=1462)

![A triumphant return to Texas. O for Ozarks. ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TB0htAbShyIrFwM7kTEd4.jpeg?height=724&width=1084)

## How Can I Help?

> “Most of us know how supportive it is merely to be in the presence of a mind that is open, quiet, playful, receptive, or reflective. These attributes are *themselves* helpful.”
>
> \- Ram Dass, *How Can I Help?*

Stanton, Missouri is a town so small that it has no population sign. But a cold call to the only church in town connected me with a lady named Jane who graciously offered to host my team in their church basement. What I didn’t anticipate was how hosting us would become a whole-of-town effort. For a place that gets few visitors, much less twenty college kids from Texas on bikes, this was a big deal. The (mostly elderly) residents of Stanton chipped in to bring us dinner, arrange snacks, craft little gifts for us, and prepare a special ceremony at church the next Sunday morning. Pastor Paul delivered a sermon in which he prayed for our safety and hoped we’d find God in our travels.

It was impossible to tell from the face of it, but this was a community facing immense pain. Pastor Paul told us about his previous life as a drug addict, fresh from the Vietnam War where he served as a deep sea diver. Drug addiction blew up his relationship with his first family and took five years from his life. He eventually found his way to God and somehow became a pastor. Today, he works at a rehab center as a counselor, helping those whose condition he appreciates more than anyone else. Pastor Paul’s scarring stories illustrated how the opioid crisis had slashed at the very fabric of his society. I met Lee, Jane’s 70 year old brother who had lost his wife to colon cancer due to inadequate healthcare just two weeks before we showed up. Jane said that he had become a shell of his former self, but found joy in telling us his stories. As we were leaving, Jane came up to me and thanked us for coming to their town. She said that there was a lot of pain and darkness in her community and that we had been a much-needed glimmer of light in their lives.

What an *absolutely* incredulous thing to hear.

The Ozarks route takes riders through the Deep South and Midwest–-areas that are relatively impoverished and have higher than average rates of cancer due to pollution, lack of healthcare, and countless other issues. How are a bunch of 20-something year olds on a bike supposed to fix any of them? We couldn’t. But somehow our presence had become a source of strength for these strangers. In undertaking this impossible journey, we were somehow spreading hope in the face of life’s countless miseries.

I met people like Dalton, a cashier at a Love’s gas station just outside of Pine Bluff, Arkansas who described his daughter’ s four year battle with cancer. She had just turned seven. The pain in his eyes has been impossible to forget. I met Nelson Kotiar, a character whose unlikely story was only possible in the US: as a young man, he had moved to America from India, found his wife, made Santa Rosa, New Mexico his home, and somehow ended up as this tiny town’s mayor. His mother in New Delhi had passed away the day we biked into Santa Rosa and despite the emotional turmoil in his life, he showed up to support us and make sure we were taken care of. His persistently joyous attitude and desire to serve others has also been impossible to forget.

![Celebrating a speedy 140 miles in Minnesota (thank you, ever elusive tailwinds)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IN41usottN9iLtDCLa5En.jpeg?height=725&width=1084)

## What’s On Your Mind?

In our group of twenty, there was a formal leadership structure meant to provide guidance to our decision making process. The two Ride Directors at the top set the tone for how we functioned as a team. To this day, I look at their leadership style as a shining example of how to navigate difficult situations and build a strong, resilient culture amidst chaos and uncertainty.

At the end of each day, having weathered the brutal heat or the bumpy roads or the bike issues or the eternal calorie deficit or all of the above, we’d sit down for a chat. All anyone wanted was to shower, eat, and sleep, but we would make it a point to get together for a team debrief and discuss the events of the day. It was an open floor for anyone to address concerns, celebrate the small victories, point out areas of improvements, and share what was on their minds. More often than not, there was always something a rider *needed* to share. The repetitive practice of debriefing led to a 1% improvement each day: we became safer bikers, more empathetic teammates, and a stronger team by being able to candidly share our thoughts. Deliberately crafting this unstructured time played a critical role in building an open and responsive team culture that I am immensely grateful for.

![A memorable 100 miles from Pocatello, Idaho to Logan, Utah](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/e0YK1niVMmmYyOgWN1QRp.jpeg?height=768&width=1024)

![Group hug after an emotional ride dedication circle in the Grand Tetons, Wyoming](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jLFYlmj58kVEb8af1NoAx.JPG?height=1080&width=1616)

## What’s Next?

Ever morning on the ride began with a sacred Texas 4000 ritual: the ride dedication circle. The team would stand in a circle, hold pinkies, and talk about why we woke up that day at an ungodly hour, with a sore body and little sleep, and still chose to get on the bike. We would share stories of people we met and dedicate our ride to them. These countless stories of suffering, resilience, and hope had become a part of us and sharing them every morning propelled our bike ride by giving us a clear, simple, raison d’être.

In other words, each day on the ride was an exercise in intense purposeful existence. On Day 71, it seemed as if we were stripped of it all. In fact, “post-ride depression” is a well documented phenomenon for most riders who do Texas 4000. You’d expect young folks like us to come from this arduous journey invigorated, self-assured, and ready to take on the challenges of post-ride life. While this might be true in the long term, the immediate aftermath of the ride is a deep pit of self-doubt, reflection, and disorientation. The reason, of course, is a distinct lack of purpose. What could possibly compare to the physical, emotional, and mental stimulation of biking 70-100 miles each day, befriending strangers across America, and bonding as a team? As the end of the ride approached, I saw this bleak future looming. I promised myself that I would live the rest of my life with the same sense of purpose, grit, and empathy that had been the hallmark of those 4000 miles.

After nearly a year since the ride, I think I’ve found my next big adventure. More on that soon.

![Preparing for a ride dedication circle in Wisconsin ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c5V38iG5QxdNs2nlnpXoT.jpeg?height=728&width=1078)

title: Exploring governance for better futures
body:
**SuperBenefit DAO is convening a short series of Twitter Spaces** to explore how the nature of governance is evolving, and to inquire into the governance we need to accelerate the arrival of better futures. We call this project *[Exploring governance for better futures](http://exploregov.xyz/)*.

We are specifically interested in how Web3 technologies are enabling new models of governance towards these ends, and their potential to combine with existing practices, perspectives, and wisdom.

Beyond the governance of organisations, communities, and networks, we’ll probe the notion of meta-governance and the practicalities of governance in a systems context.

## Three conversations

Over three conversations, we will engage with people who bring different and complementary perspectives to governance. This will include experience and views from DAOs, other decentralised networks, the co-operative movement, Indigenous cultures, purpose-led business, and civic and systems innovation.

We will explore perspectives on the essential functions and attributes of governance, and the design implications for governance arrangements that seek to foster decentralisation, pluralism, and regeneration.

Each of the conversations will be framed around a question:

1. **June 2, 2022:** Metagovernance - what is it and what’s its potential?
2. **June 16, 2022:** DAO to DAO - what are we seeing and learning from inter-DAO cooperation?
3. **June 30, 2022:** New and old - what can Web3 learn from and contribute to existing governance perspectives and practices?

All Twitter Spaces will take place from 6:30 to 7:30 pm EST and will be hosted on the [SuperBenefit Twitter account.](https://twitter.com/superbenefitdao)

* **[Click here to set a reminder](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1DXxyDedVabJM) for the next Twitter Space on June 30.**
* Listen to a recording of the [first Twitter space](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1rmGPgQyzOjKN) (on the subject of metagovernance) from June 2 or the [second Twitter space](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1PlJQaVzbNaJE) (DAO to DAO) from June 16.
* To share this page easily, you can use the link [exploregov.xyz](http://exploregov.xyz/)

## Conversation 1: Metagovernance - what is it and what’s its potential?

Taking place from 6:30 to 7:30 pm EST on Thursday, June 2, **the first Twitter Space in this series** featured:

* **[Bryan Petes](https://twitter.com/BryanPetes)** – Cofounder [@TeamSobol](https://twitter.com/TeamSobol) | Also playing the DAO game w/ [@banklessDAO](https://twitter.com/banklessDAO), [@CityDAO](https://twitter.com/CityDAO), [@DAOPunksNFT](https://twitter.com/DAOPunksNFT), [@PolygonDAO](https://twitter.com/PolygonDAO), [@ReputableDAO](https://twitter.com/ReputableDAO) in my spare cycles.
* **[Gabagool.Ξth](https://twitter.com/gabagooldoteth)** – on-chain sleuth: [@InfoTokenDAO](https://twitter.com/InfoTokenDAO)

title: Tokenomics for Milady Community Token: A Proposal
body:
I present the following as a proposal for the Tokenomics of the Milady Community Token, which was introduced earlier today and raised $40k seed funding in under an hour.

Despite this early enthusiasm, some questions did arise about the usability of the token, specifically the level of integration with the overall mission of the Remilia Collective and the creation of “use cases.”  As such, I provide this document as a proposal for the Tokenomics of the Milady Community Token.

**Authors Note**: I am generally unfamiliar with the world of finance, blockchain, and crypto in general, so I spent over 25 minutes reviewing other Tokenomics papers to gather ideas.  I was especially interested in a coin called Terra and Luna, which had some really exciting ideas that spurred my imagination and showed me the true power of the blockchain.  While I still don’t understand everything, I think I’ve read enough to know that if you want to be successful, you’re going to have to set yourself apart.

To that end, I offer this proposal (and please note it is just a proposal, I have no formal relationship with the Milady Community Token or its founders) as a means to set this token apart.  WAY apart.

Alright, here we go:

### Milady Community Token

Tokenomics Proposal
27 Jun 2022
Roderick Früht

It’s morning in America, and what was once a thriving nation of entrepreneurs, engineers, and fanatics has now receded into a blind hypnotized submission.  The dairy cows are no longer being milked, there are no dairy cows at all.  Imagine now, you are on a farm.  Imagine now, if you will, wind chimes gently clanging against one another singing their mournful song, pan now with the camera of your mind past a rocking chair in a ghostly perpetual motion on the front porch.

Now through the front door our mind camera goes, gazing upon the dusty furniture not sat upon in years, a curled edge of a picture frame so muted by time the faces have become blurred thumbprints, and finally now into the kitchen.  Amidst all of the atrophy and rust, there is a pristine table with four plates, perfectly set, untouched by time.

> The words on the screen appear: “We invite you to sit.”

> Fade to Black

> Now appears before you on the movie screen of your mind:

> “Milady Community Token: A Story of Trust”

Let us now enter **The Tokenomics Zone**.


---

The usage of the Milady Community Token can be summed up in one word: *interesting*.

What if we did the one thing with this token that no one else in the business was willing to do?  What if we pulled back the veil and told you the one Oedipal truth that always hides behind mommy whenever someone comes asking?

**What if we told you that there was absolutely no purpose to this token?**

What would happen if we told you that?  Would you *freak out*?

> Fade to black

> Words appear on screen: “Don’t Freak Out.”

> An orbicular golden image beings to materialize, it is the Milady Community Token, spinning in an *angelic* perpetual motion (to stand in thematic contrast to the rocking chair from before).

I mean sure, it would probably behoove us to pretend that there was some reason for making this coin.  Or that there is some big “prize” for buying it.  We might even want to insinuate that holding this token will allow you to have some “special level of access” to the Milady community - VIP rooms, one-to-one’s with Charlotte, a free subscription to Seed Oil Streaming+, all manner of special features and add-ons for your Milady pfp, etc., etc.  But the truth is that **none of that is going to happen**.  And we’re sort of tired of even suggesting that.

Let’s try something different.  Let’s try throwing away everything about a normal Tokenomics document - the staking, the project contributions, the exchange of value - let’s throw away all that bullshit for just a few.

Now imagine instead that we just embraced the fact that this token had **no value**.  And now let’s embrace the fact that this token has **unlimited value**.  What would that look like?  I’m not talking about a mindset, I’m talking about a way in which we could truly demonstrate a commitment to a value-less token while at the same time running up the fucking score on its price.  How could we do this?

Well that comes down to whether or not you actually believe in

A. Network Spirituality

Buying this token is an act of faith.  It is the ultimate “field of dreams.”  You must actually believe that “if you buy, it will come.”  If you do not believe this, then do not buy the token.

B. Post-Authorship

If you buy this token, you must submit to the idea that you are not buying it for yourself.

What does this mean?

> Fade to black

> Words appear on screen: “What does this mean?”

What if we used this token to standardize a sort of *financial* pseudonymity?  What if we used this token to harness chaos into something beautiful?  What if we could make this token *more meaningful* by *fully embracing its meaninglessness*?

At this point you’re probably worried that I am teetering on the brink of some real “mumbo-jumbo.”  Have no fear, I’m about to make this dream very real.  Allow to me to introduce the most radical feature of the Milady Community Token:

**Payments with the Milady Community Token will never go to the intended recipient.**

…Instead, they will go to a random Milady.

Let me say that again: if you, the Milady buyer (person A), purchases a $295 Balenciaga hat from a Milady seller (person B), at the point of submitting/processing that payment, the money will go to another randomly generated Milady wallet (person C) not involved in the original transaction.

> Fade to black

> Words appear on screen: He said whaaaaat?

Now you may scoff at what I’ve just said.  You may wonder why anyone would ever purchase anything with this arrangement.  You might laugh at the mere *suggestion* of it.  You might say, “who would be stupid enough to accept a payment that won’t even go to them?”

But let me ask you this question instead: “who would be stupid enough to *not* use a token that would randomly pay them multiple times a day for doing absolutely nothing at all?”

How would this financial system be maintained?  Wouldn’t there need to be a constant cycle of purchasing to sustain an enclosed economy such as this?

Yes there would.

Well who the hell would buy into any economy in which money is not appropriately transferred from a buyer to an intended seller? (you may ask)

To answer this question, I direct you to research the history of the Milady and its consistent anti-fragility in the face of chaos.


---

The Milady Community Token is a mathematical representation of Network Spirituality that can be monitored in real-time.  It shows the movement not only of our desires, but also of our love.  We buy into it freely, like throwing coins into a wishing well that we can only *wish* to get back.  Meanwhile, the token encounters the next rung of pseudonymity: letting go of the authorship of our purchases and our money.  Where our money emerges from and where it goes is not something that we should be personalizing anymore.  It’s really not up to us.  The more we can give ourselves over to this notion, the more the Network will break through the dark soil and grow upward toward the sun  We water this token the way that we water our plants on the windowsill.

But windowsill plants can be fussy.  Sometimes they need more water, sometimes less.  Sometimes they whither for no reason, sometimes they have to fight a little just to prove that to themselves that they can survive.  Sometimes they need to feel the sun on their face, sometimes they need to hide away from the sun altogether while they remember who they are: just a plant.  just nobody at all.  just happy to be alive.

If that last paragraph seems like a joke to you, I urge you to NOT buy Milady Community Tokens.


---

This project raised $40,000 in 40 minutes.  It wasn’t even difficult.  It had milady stamped on it and so nothing more was needed.  Think of how much power could be unleashed in 40 hours, or days, or years?  Unlimited.  We feed this power with the token.  We love the token.  We need the token.  We give away the token.  We are happy to find it again.  We are happy to give it away again.  It’s all good.

Unfortunately that’s all that can be said before veering into the territory of bullshit.  Thank you for considering your purchase of the Milady Community Token


---

*Disclaimer: this was a work of speculative fiction and in no way represents a real financial plan.  Right?  Right.  …Right.  Right.  Right?*

title: Solidity Coverage in VS Code with Foundry
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/MI5c3NdbzakUKhOfGfCJz.png?height=500&width=750)

Yeah, I know you’ve probably heard about the hype by now. People are flocking to Foundry and there’s nothing you can do about it. So, strap in, there’s been a new release which brings coverage reporting!

## Install / Upgrade Foundry

First, make sure you’re on the latest version of Foundry. If you don’t have it, [get it here](https://getfoundry.sh/).

If you do have it installed already, get the latest version by running:

```
$ foundryup
```

## View Coverage

To get a coverage report, it all starts with:

```
$ forge coverage
```

By default this will display a summary, which will look like this:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oP-eGIyXvfGEpUwvUpamE.png?height=680&width=1610)

It’s already quite nice, but you can change the output via the *--report* flag. In order to get the coverage displayed nicely in VS Code, we need to use the [LCOV](https://github.com/linux-test-project/lcov) reporter. So, run:

```
$ forge coverage --report lcov
```

You should now have a *lcov.info* file in your project directory. LCOV files can be parsed by many tools / extensions. In the case of VS Code I recommend [Coverage Gutters](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ryanluker.vscode-coverage-gutters).

1. Install the Coverage Gutters extension.
2. Open the file you want to see coverage results for.
3. Open the command palette in VS Code (CMD+SHIFT+P or CTRL+SHIFT+P by default) and type “Display Coverage”, you should see the option “Coverage Gutters: Display Coverage“, select it.
4. Now, your file should be nicely colored line-by-line showing if a line has been hit or not (green for hit, red for missed).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/MgyGkQTKDA-KYKWnsSSZo.png?height=774&width=1548)

Obviously, there are some issues present. The constructor is definitely being hit in my tests, but it’s showing as a miss! Coverage in Foundry is still very much a work-in-progress, but it’s great that we have an initial version so we can start setting up our tooling and processes around it. Knowing the Foundry team, this feature will quickly blossom into another example of what the premier Solidity testing framework has to offer.

## Example Repos

* All the examples in this repo were performed on my [ERC4626Votes repo](https://github.com/devanonon/ERC4626Votes).
* [Onbjerg](https://twitter.com/onbjerg) has a nice [example repo which includes the Codecov GitHub action](https://github.com/onbjerg/forge-coverage-test). He also built the actual coverage feature, so kudos to him!

title: 体验
body:
\[\[用户体验\]\]是产品如何与外界产生联系并发挥作用，也就是人们如何接触和使用它的。 用户体验**不是**产品本身是如何工作的。

用户价值 = （新体验-旧体验）- 替换成本

优秀的设计师提供愉悦的体验。

体验非常重要，因为它体现了用户有多么怀念他们与产品的互动。互动时，人们总体感觉是正面的，还是令人沮丧和困惑？==当家用科技产品难以理解，我们会迷茫、失望甚至生气，所有这些都是强烈的负面情绪。如果产品的易通性很好，人们会感到掌控、满足甚至骄傲所有这些强烈的积极情绪。

当与一个产品互动时，我们需要弄清楚如何操作。这意味着搞明白它做什么，它是如何工作的，以及如何操作，即可视性。可视性得自适当地运用五种基本心理学概念：**示能，意符，约束，映射和反馈**，这些在接下来的几章中会有所涉及。但还有第六个原则，或许是所有里面最重要的：系统的概念模型。概念模型让用户真正理解产品。
