## The Internet

Today, literacy is one measure of success of schools. How many children and adults could read and write in certain languages focused by the school/country? And to how deep a level their understanding and knowledge is? Generally, the internet boom opened the door to cross-border communication without travelling to foreign countries. Though it still lacks the “intermingling” essence of travelling worldwide (believe me; having to speak to people you look down to in front of you is very different from sending them a text message), it facilitates general sharing of information outside attending school.

Traditional schools aren’t always in a good position. Educations haven’t evolved in most countries for the past centuries, still teaching about information from the previous centuries before talking a bit on the cutting edge of technologies nowadays. With internet, though, people get access to cutting edge technologies, research papers, and knowledge shared by people working on the cutting edge via blogs, vlogs, videos, and other means. It makes sense then, to learn something that’s old in school; but to learn something new on the internet.

And the internet opens the door to self-learning. Although not always being appreciated during interviews for work application, and it’s neither officially appreciated by officials, it is one of the most important source of education we have nowadays. With the constant and quick change in world situation, it’s almost impossible to record them down on papers and books anymore. Writing a book in a subject that quickly change, we never know how quickly it’ll goes into deprecation. Blogs and videos now replaces educations: with constantly changing, up-to-date teachings. Though it’s not always arranged in an order we learn in school; they do help us learn a bit here and there, choose what we’re interested in learning, and go deep into the topic. Internet that allows editing facilitates quick changes. With books, we may need to write version 2 version 3; with paper, we may need to write on new paper, and waste lots of paper recording new information and throwing away old information. With the internet, it’s just an “edit” button. We quickly change information if we know what we’ve previously thought true but actually false was written. Saves paper too!

Some countries though, like Finland, caught up with education via an education reform. As of [Smartcuts](https://archive.org/details/smartcutshowhack0000snow), Schools in Finland now teaches people how to use a platform (like how to perform differentiation on a calculator) rather than the actual study (like mathematics: how to perform differentiation with hands and paper), and they found success. Furthermore, students aren’t jack of all trades; but jack of some trades. Students are allowed to pick a few subjects they’re interested in and study deeper into the subject. It proves that, jack of all trades that touches barely the surface in lots of different fields scored worse than students whom are jack of some trades that study deeper into several fields of their interest. Jack of all trades is better than master of one: and jack of some trades is better than both jack of all trades and master of one. It’s not too focused on a single subject, but also not too spread out across the surface.

That’s exactly how we self-learn on the internet. We learn how to use websites rather than memorization of details. We could always search for information we need online. Of course, we can always learn memorization like memory palace just to improve our memories if that’s our goal; otherwise, it’s not necessary to memorize information when they’re available to us to search. Information we have is not just those in our brains, but also those that are available for us to search, and those we know where to search for them. Furthermore, self-learning slowly aligns us to how we best take in information rather than how our teacher thinks we best take in information: hence we can learn better and happier if we have the choice to choose how we learn them. In schools, that’s only available outside lectures, and lectures are mostly still the same old lectures (particularly boring eh, depending on who’s holding the lecture: some lecturers make them interesting, though).

Also, the era of internet makes it possible for Big Data to thrives. Big Data not only record larger quantity of information, but better quality of information. In the past, due to the restrictions of writing, especially before the invention of papers, only the largest of events could be recorded down in historical books. What we know today are historical events that at least changes how an empire ruling decisions; or wars that are influential enough to be recorded down on the historical book. As papers get invented and more information can be recorded easier than carving on bamboo books, smaller events, such as more detailed description of the kings’ everyday lives, or how cities looks like (in a few sentences), and maps of the cities with greater precision exists. That’s why we know more information about histories record in later centuries than earlier centuries. Though, lacking in historians or awareness to be a historian is another reason for the lost of histories. Nowadays, Big Data can record specific information of an experiment down to the very details; and it can store lots of experiments, useful or non-useful, influential or non-influential, on the internet, for anybody to access it when they need it, now or in the future. Data could be recorded in shorter intervals: we can easily preserve news everyday without having a store with physical newspapers: and for a very long time. We can even preserve news in the hour interval than in the day or month interval. We can even preserve news from various news reporters. Generally, this is big data: shorter interval of taking data, plus larger range of data sources, aggregates into something that may or may not be useful, due to the advent of cheaper but larger sized hard disk (usually, but SSD also works) and faster internet connections.

Though, as the internet facilitates information sharing, it’s not just those trustable can share information, but also those not trustable. It’s not necessarily true what you seen on an internet is real: some people uses words like “this is like”, “this works like this” instead of “perhaps it is”, “this may be”: tricking our brain that what they said are facts rather than opinions. Certainly, facts does makes what they spoke more acceptable, and generally something firm is more easily acceptable by people; at the expense of lying to their readers, not informing them that it’s just an opinion. Others tends to keep only the positives of the information that boost their face and hide the negative information that they thought will lose their face. In fact, it may be true that your teachers grade you higher in university if you wrote one report that only reports the positive and hides the negative; or you get a lower grade if your negative report is longer than a certain percentage of your total reports. White lies and refusing to report everything cause those reading the report not aware of hidden information. That’s why we have to be careful learning on the internet, taking from not only trusted source, but if it’s important for us, to look through lots and lots of sources before making conclusion, plus don’t censor ourselves when we’re looking for information, deliberately ignoring those that we don’t like and only read those we like.

Machine Learning makes it easy to make fake comments for propaganda. Closer to a voting period, a language model could make comments that affects its fellow readers thinking lots of people are supporting a certain person. This allows altering the voting process from fair to unfair. In fact, if the fake comments make up the majority of the comments section, it’s very likely users whom skim through the contents think that it’s normal and everyone is voting for this particular person. Only those keeping a skeptical look and search out whether it’s manipulated shall find out its fakeness. Otherwise, most users won’t have the time to look closely and examine whether they’re being manipulated or not by hidden propagandas.

And we can’t be sure that news and histories we seen online are real. Held on a centralized server and database, any entity could manipulate the information after it’s released. For an edit like Github that allows revisions, we can easily look back at its edit history and decide whether it has been edited to lie to its readers on histories. Others that doesn’t implement the revision histories, or even deletable revision histories via normal or abnormal means, isn’t totally believable. Centralized news platform could also be influenced by conglomerate regarding information being released to public even before its first release. Webpages could be taken down via any forms of attacks and tactics if it affects the faces of certain influencing conglomerate.

Overall, audiences could be considered passive. Indeed, most people nowadays refuse to think if they don’t have to. Maybe they do think, only in their workplace on the things they’re working at, that they cannot not think; but outside, reading news etc, they prefer to relax and just passively absorb whatever information is presented to them without thinking too much and getting headache later. This makes easy for fake information and propaganda to influence when they’re passively absorbing information. Also, most people would not try to look for multiple sources of information, to clarify: it would take too much time, and they aren’t specifically into researching for information truth. Generally, if a news platform earns its trust of the members, it has the ability, before it’s being distrusted, to manipulate its audience at least once, for whatever reasons.

By building a walled gardens, and by ensuring everyone builds a walled gardens, the profit-receiving groups ensure they are the only users’ choice. User can choose not to use their product; but they cannot choose alternative products. All alternative products, be it their competitors or cooperators, implements similar tactics. As a whole, the unsounded policy guarantees that, although they fight between them, the bottom people would still go to them, whoever “them” is. And people or startups attempting to break the cycle may end up being warned; or for startups, being acquired by one of the conglomerates. It’s an unbreakable black hole, at least by a minority community.

## Web3 and Blockchain

Now comes another change to how information are shared with the introduction of web3 and blockchain. Blockchain aims for WORM (Write Once Read Many), decentralization, and transparency. Some of the problem we listed in the previous section are what blockchain technology tries to solve. Certainly, the solutions may not be perfect; and one doubt there exist a perfect solution; but it certainly will lay better foundation for the future.

### Transparency

With companies nowadays asking users for their information, it’s important to understand how they use our information. Most mentioned that with a privacy policy: a long and extremely boring list of policies, taking advantage that users would be bored out to death reading it hence missing something, and force them to accept the privacy policy before we could use their product. And privacy policy can be changed anytime: with just an email notification to the users that the privacy policy changed. Given that most users are already bored to death on the first encounters to ultra-long privacy policy; it’s a wonder how many people read the changes. Automatically, privacy policy is just there to inform users that something has changed: it doesn’t ask for reconfirmation from users that they really accept what’s being changed. It’s “we already informed you. Since you didn’t react after we inform, we assume you agree with what we mentioned; so now that your information had been use like this and like that, it’s your fault for not disagreeing in the first place.” And privacy policy doesn’t mean that information are being used in ways that’s not listed down on the privacy policy. Perhaps it’s used to train a machine learning model, and they think since nobody (except the model) sees it, it’s not required to state in the privacy policy. Duh?

Generally, what you stored on the internet aren’t confirmed private. How about data stored on cloud services? Well, they explained lots of securities about how they deal with hackers, and where your data are stored. They explain if you buy which plan, they will have upgraded security and extra security measures against hackers. None of these targets internally. We don’t know if your cloud service provider will use your information stored on their hard disk for other uses, like training a machine learning model. Overall, nothing is confirmed, despite what they speaks to you. It’s a wonder whether your activites on a rented VM is visible to the cloud service provider: so they could block you if, say, you use the VM for crypto mining; or maybe for other reasons that kinda go against their will. If they could watch your activities, perhaps via a log file or something, then it’s highly probably they could know what you’re doing and even what information are stored if you use their services.

Moreover, ever received weird emails before, especially institution emails created by someone for you? I do, when one went to university and one uses their email address, one keeps receiving email (mostly in my language Chinese) about “do you want services to help write your essay?” or “do you want services to help proofread/check your exam essays?” One was wondering whether my school sold our email addresses to “spammers” targeting students; or it’s just spammers that gets so clever and manage to hack into the school database storing students’ email addresses that they could promote to…

Blockchains doesn’t aim for privacy, but **anonymity**. Instead of storing your information privately somewhere, blockchain refuse to collect real information about you unless required. Say, if you give information of your medical health record: aside from paying you for the information uploaded, they also only link it to your wallet address. If you didn’t tell anyone about the “hidden” wallet address, and you take care of not interacting your “hidden” wallet address with your main wallet address, you kinda make yourself anonymous without anyone knowing who exactly you are except for people whom you specifically told to or knows about your symptoms and guess it out and you acknowledge their guess. No more collecting your names, nationality, and things that determine your identity. Maybe age is needed, to see if certain disease/symptoms occur only at a certain age, I don’t know. Overall, that did what privacy policy was originally invented for, right? Privacy policy is to prevent other people from knowing your information if you don’t want them to know. Anonymity also does the same by unlink your real identity from the information you agreed to share publicly.

Also, without privacy policy, it’s not necessary to accept a privacy policy before using the product, like it is required now. If you don’t accept a privacy policy, they refuse you from using their product. That’s rude. Choose not to collect information and allow users to continue to use your products rather than forcing them to accept the privacy policy.

Blockchain also try to change the way of how organization operates. Instead of private operations that aren’t known to the users; many operations are publicized so users know how corporations operates, where do their information are being used, how it’s being used, and why it’s being used. Other used-to-be private information also gets publicized, letting consumers understand how their product are created and how the culture of the company is. Consumers trust the companies more -- they see for themselves instead of hearing what’s being spoken, which might or might not be true.

It moves users from trying to think how to save private information on-chain, to refuse to give private information if it’s truly wanted private. Anything on-chain, even if encryption can work, is public. People know how much money you have: it’s public. Well, people don’t know how much money you have: if you don’t tell anyone what are your wallet address. And people don’t know how much money you have, if you don’t transfer money between two (independent) accounts via any means. When there’s no link between two ledgers, you conceal your relationship. When you don’t link yourself to a wallet address, you conceal your identity. Still private, but let’s rethink what it means by “private”.

### WORM (Write Once Read Many) and Decentralization

While histories since millenials ago are easily lost, due to burning of books, tearing of pages ordered by kings, and only keeping a single record, nowadays these, replaced with internet and people voluntarily backing up information in various servers prevent histories lost. Before the advent of the internet, we depends on people witnessing the stories to tell to others in a rather ineffective way, only to a small group of people they could reach to. Now, anything posted on the internet publicly is available to audiences from all around the world. Records are more difficult to be lost (unless the whole internet is destroyed), which probably requires a global consensus to remove internet or Earth facing mass eradication (humanity extinct isn’t totally removing histories: who knows there may be new knowledgeable species that thrives and their archaeologists discover what we left, so it’s not totally lost in that case; but mass eradication destroys all of our traits we left behind even after we got extinct: archaeologists of future species cannot find out that we exist before on Earth).

Also, information are immutable (WORM). Unless the author is forced before he/she published the information online to change the history, anything that’s published on IPFS are immutable. Even the owner could not delete the information. The only way to delete is via consensus, that all IPFS providers agree on destroying that piece of information; or by wiping out all IPFS providers on Earth. This ensures that histories that’s being posted online and discovered later by conglomerate whom decides they want to change these writings cannot do anything, as even blackmailing the writer, he/she has no power to remove the writings after it’s published. It isn’t always beneficial to the publishers though, if they accidentally found out they posted information that they want to remove now. But overall, the change helped preserve histories; and it also teaches publishers to take responsibility for what they have posted (with an “are you sure” button by requiring publishers to sign the transaction to finalizes its publishing).

And if a news platform isn’t controlled by a centralized entity but a decentralized entity, that it requires voting to verify its truth before posting, deems itself more true than postings from a centralized entity. After all, we mentioned centralized entity could be forced to change their mind on their postings before the first posting. Decentralized entity requires capturing all the news provider that may exist in several different countries before control could be done. And since news requires communicating with each other: this communication channel being on a public “database” rather than private database means, after they started communicating, anyone can verify it and finalizes the posting of information. A private database, on the other hand, allows taking down before it’s being displayed to the public. A public decentralized database (ahem, the blockchain itself, or IPFS) storing the communication records doesn’t.

And even today, we still consider selling information to the public. It makes sense, though. People are finding ways they could earn some money to rear themselves -- and selling information is one way. We can’t expect people to always open up public information -- they also need to feed themselves. Unless people could subscribe and donate to them monthly so the writers don’t have to worry about paying their bills, “free for others at the expense of myself ending up as a beggar” is not something doable. With Blockchain, one looks at websites like [BookCoin](https://www.bookcoin.com/) allowing people to collect NFTs and have extra benefits holding the NFT, ranging from discussion with authors to create a v2 version of the book via consensus, filling in holes and missing information that’s previously not available in the book, disproving anything that the book might got it wrong, etc. It’s quite difficult to imagine, if the author doesn’t have another job, he/she could survive on the meager earnings that the book brings.

Another thing is time and effort put in on writing the book (or maybe just an article). Blogs that one usually write doesn’t have deep research, writings mostly on one’s findings rather than incorporate others’ findings, when one was doing something for a period of time. It could be programming, it could be social problems, it could be any life struggles one faced from time to time. On the other hand, things that requires more stricter research to ensure its correctness requires much more time to write, as we need examples to convince the reader that the writing is backed by research. Generally, it’s good if people does collect NFT when the authors put it up at the end, that books may take a long time to write. It’s not good if people take advantage of “transparency” in blockchain, just reading what the authors have written but not collecting anything, especially if we can read that the authors actually does their research and take time to write the book. Even nowadays, libraries pay at least a single copy to the author before lending it out to their members to read. It’s quite confusing how could blockchain ensures sufficient earnings from authors to rear themselves without finding an extra job. Though, based on [Writing isn’t a good idea by Elle Griffin](https://elle.mirror.xyz/aiIV4RSromGsS49Lv724BO0zkGkZmzfBZhmkjfIOvK4), one can see how difficult it is for writers to earn, even nowadays.

Maybe in the future, books won’t have an author anymore. A community gather together to work on different chapters of the book, and aggregate the information, writing different chapters separately, before having a single person (or group) to aggregate the information, ensuring that information flows smoothly from these independently-written chapters and finally aggregate into a single book. The information published online might not even have earnings: it’s difficult to think, in this case, what extra benefits NFT holders could earn if they already is a group of people participating in creation of the book without an author. Maybe “writers” or “author” lose their full-time job: it becomes something of an aggregated sense rather than a “one person author”. I don’t know. And writers nowadays, based on bookcoin, earns based on extra benefits like one to one with authors. While that kinda makes sense with fiction; one isn’t sure it always make sense with non-fiction. Overall, there might be an incentive (like pre-order) to pay the authors, and upon reaching a certain amount, a new chapter is written. Otherwise, it’s difficult to understand, unless voluntarily, why one would published something that tooks months or even years to complete freely and author end up as a beggar.

## Conclusion

Knowledge started off vital for survival. Hunting, farming, gathering, making a shelter. They increase our chances of survival in a harsh environment. As we’re freed from worrying about basic requirements, enjoyable knowledge like music and poetry exists. People tries to fill their time with whatever that makes them enjoyable; and when we’re freed from hunting for basic requirements, we have more time to learn enjoyable knowledges, or just sitting down and enjoy a piece of music. Today, knowledge are everywhere, and we appreciate we cannot learn everything ourselves. They are stored on the internet. Not only does useful and enjoyable information exists, but also rubbish information that doesn’t mean anything and/or not useful, and repeated information that rephrase a certain information in another way to reach to different audiences.

Knowledge also grow in size. The skills vital for survival are learnt by everyone, and can be learnt by everyone, as it’s simple enough and must be simple enough for everyone to remember if they were to survive. Not everyone has the capacity to learn music and poetry: though some could study with grit, they certainly requires the time to do so. Plus not everyone is interested in them, too. They can now choose whether or not to acquire optional knowledges. Unless survival knowledge and skills that they must acquire if they are to survive, irregardless of whether they like it or not; these optional skills may put you in better situation in the society, such as the ruling classes; but they aren’t necessary for survival. Nowadays, no one single person can memorize everything on the internet down to the details recorded. People choose what to learn, what to specialize. They can learn a few; but that’s basically it; not everything. There’s just too much information.

Knowledge also changed their way of inheritance: from being inherited at home to being taught in school to being self-learned on the internet. As the society matured, new ways of transferring knowledge from one generation to another generation exists. School allow teaching information outside of a single family or a single tribe: within the whole country initially, and later opened to foreign countries. Internet allows anyone with access to the internet to learn anything that’s been made publicly available. And blockchain works their way to take down paywalls (i.e. information that requires pay to read) and (perhaps) private walls (i.e. information that is not accessible to the public, only to a minority that meets the requirement, or within a specific groups: usually these aren’t private to two people or a group, like research papers that are only available to specific institutions. It doesn’t corporate your secret conversation with your spouse, okay), letting key information accessible by the public for free. And hopefully public appreciate the shared knowledge and collect an NFT to support the author!

Finally, we want control. Conglomerate also wants control. It doesn’t feels good if something is out of your control. When you plan for how things go, but things aren’t in your control, you can only change it to this much, not totally changing it. It’s no wonder that blockchain trying to regain control, or more exactly, to dissipates control, gets lots of attention from conglomerate. Propaganda such as “blockchain are high risk, you can lose your money” or “crypto is a scam, a Ponzi Scheme” keeps people from using it. As long as people don’t use blockchain, conglomerate retains their control. It goes against conglomerate’s will to state that: blockchain is not crypto, blockchain is just related to crypto, and we have stablecoins. Nope: blockchain is crypto, and crypto is high risk, so blockchain is high risk. Don’t use blockchain.

Let us appreciate the evolution of knowledge and what we have today. For those that are starved of knowledge, let us appreciate that people in the past don’t have sufficient knowledge to satisfy their insatiable appetite to devour more knowledges: and we have. Let us appreciate that blockchain tries to publicize knowledges, to unite everyone as one, to move the world’s progress forward.

Let us appreciate, that we can be a more knowledgeable person today.

## References

* [Brittanica](https://www.britannica.com/topic/education/Education-in-the-earliest-civilizations)

title: 关于指纹浏览器使用场景、IP和批量操作指南
body:
自上次这篇文章：

之后很多人来问我各种问题，这边统一解答一下，让你在使用上更轻松。

针对之前无论是评论还是私聊的各种问题，我都总结在这里，这些问题你一定会遇到，先看看，如果日后用到再返回来仔细看！

## 要不要用指纹浏览器？

首先你要明白指纹浏览器做到了啥，就是帮你改变了浏览器的指纹，再加上一个独立IP，那么别人很难去识别你是多开选手。

明白了这个，就能回答很多人问我的问题了。

撸毛要不要用指纹浏览器？

其实绝大部分情况是不用，因为很多项目都是链上数据统计空投，不会记录你的浏览器信息和IP。

但是，也不是所有项目方都如此，如果有个统计指纹和IP的项目方也合情合理，因为越来越卷了，他们也想尽力排除羊毛党。

再比如，你要搞 premint 的批量抽奖，用指纹浏览器就可以批量搞。

搞 sunflower 也可以用指纹浏览器批量。

所以到底要不要用这个问题，大家可以自己测试，或者根据自己的经济能力来做。

## 为什么要用 AdsPower？

其实这个问题是问的比较多的，那么多指纹浏览器，为啥要用AdsPower啊？

于是那段时间我就搜了搜，找到了我能搜到的所有国内的指纹浏览器，并进行了各种对比，还做了一个表，不过是半年前的事情了，价格应该有出处，这里仅供参考吧。

![](https://mirror.xyz/\_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2FuAPQqv6r7BgXdVtjNBl_r.png\&w=1200\&q=90)

我的测评维度就是便宜、指纹效果好、有接口可以用。

这里直接说结论，如果你是手动党，就随便玩玩，免费的hubstudio就行，你随便玩，指纹隐藏的也很完美。

如果你是批量技术党，那还是用AdsPower比较好，因为有几家的技术真的太辣鸡了，客服也说清楚，最后还是退款了…

AdsPower在技术这方面肯定甩开其他很远，贵有贵的道理。

## AdsPower 也太贵了吧？

确实贵，如果你的浏览器窗口数量较多，成本直线上升。

之前也有有人要过我的邀请码，当时也不太懂，邀请了也没优惠。

有很多朋友问了优惠之后，我就找他们去要了优惠，但是这个优惠好像只能新用户用，如果你不嫌弃注册一个新账号麻烦，可以搞一下，优惠很多。

首先必须用我的邀请链接注册：

然后注册时候的邀请码不要修改，直接输入邮箱和密码注册即可。

我的专属优惠码是【dfarm】

![](https://mirror.xyz/\_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2FOWeVIBnNifU2ejvzxlLrZ.png\&w=1920\&q=90)

仅限免费用户和试用用户，你通过我的邀请链接注册后，在升级成付费版界面的优惠码一栏填入我的优惠码就可以享受优惠了，目前是首月95折，长期优惠是3个月88折，6个月78折，12个月68折。

因为是新用户专享，所以老用户续费的话是用不了的，注册个新账号也只需要个邮箱，能省就省，懂得都懂。

## AdsPower 里面这个IP去哪里买？

说道IP，要重点说说，IP要求非常高。

如果你用过那些万人用的辣鸡IP，你会发现你这个IP用啥封啥，用推特就封，用discord就封，很痛苦。各种网站的防火墙都不让你进…

所以如果有条件，还是推荐独享的固定IP养号。

注意是养号用，不是撸毛，撸毛对IP的要求就没那么高。

AdsPower 里其实也带着911之类的IP，但是价格较贵，还是按次使用，如果频繁使用可以考虑包月IP。

这里推荐独享固定IP是：

proxy6 我个人已经用了一年了，没啥问题，独享一个月1.77美元，共享0.59美元。

这个价格是我找到里面最低的了，因为IP这个东西提供服务的服务商很多。

大部分干几个月就跑了，所以大家包月买安全一些。

![](https://mirror.xyz/\_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2FTT36qP8CzqKVSPkRM4Kwr.png\&w=3840\&q=90)

proxy6 提供了非常多地区可以选择，数量也比较充足。

## AdsPower 如何批量操作？

这里我只推荐写代码，使用 Selenium 操作是最简单的方式，写一个脚本，让所有窗口去运行即可。

Selenium 的教程大家可以去网上搜一搜。

虽然 AdsPower 提供了RPA 可以写一些脚本，但是每次执行需要另付费，成本较高不推荐。

还有网上有人提供同步器，就是同时打开几个窗口操作的工具。

也不推荐，同步器同时打开操作的窗口数量上限看你的电脑配置，有时候你开了10个操作，可能中间有1个窗口掉队了，就非常麻烦。

因为有数量限制，所以也不可能成百上千的去操作。

还有一点，就是网上下载的同步器可能有病毒和木马，这一点尤为要小心，别被别人撸了毛。

## AdsPower 如何批量装小狐狸钱包？

其实AdsPower 批量安装浏览器插件，应该是点开“应用中心”进行安装。

但是，这里需要注意，这种用第三方的安装方式不安全，可能这里面的小狐狸被人动过手脚。

社区里面有位朋友一直怀疑钱包被盗跟应用中心的插件有关系，所以我们可以自己安装。

打开小狐狸钱包的官方GitHub:

如下图所示，直接点击就可以下载插件包：

![](https://mirror.xyz/\_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2FjQo2GJy_itylvaqHLS6ez.png\&w=3840\&q=90)

然后我们来到AdsPower的应用中心，点击“上传应用”

![](https://mirror.xyz/\_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2F-bT15Z04ZhSP6JW-MY6Cl.png\&w=1920\&q=90)

安装包选择刚才下载zip文件，名称随便写一下就可以了。

这时候你打开指纹浏览器，就可以找到刚才安装的插件了！

![](https://mirror.xyz/\_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.mirror-media.xyz%2Fpublication-images%2FoLdvY1oIHWRPJx2GLClJY.png\&w=1080\&q=90)

右下角这里记得打开！

## 最后

其实不是所有场景都要用到指纹浏览器，所以务必理性消费。

title: Decentralized Technologies in African Cities.
body:
**In this blog post, we will be talking about promoting decentralized technologies in African cities, and how that can be done. It will take a balancing act but we can't afford not to experiment.**

Africa as a region is experiencing growth rapidly than any other region in the world leading to urbanization and increased need for infrastructure and technology, and at the same time the finances needed to achieve their goals. To the population of Africa, cities present opportunities to improve lives and livelihoods. From serving our most basic needs to enabling our most ambitious ventures in trade and technology, cities' infrastructure and services should aspire to support our well being and development.

African cities find themselves in a position demanding transformation in order to meet the needs of the residents as well as open up economies to the world. The modern narratives and systems of development and growth are failing in meeting these challenges. Design of African cities needs rethinking, remodelling and reworking to face the urgent challenges of sustainability. Cities function only if there is provision of public goods for all citizens, and if there is an institutional and regulatory framework, which can harness market forces for economic opportunities and well being for all.

While this is happening, Innovation, in decentralized systems and Blockchain technology continue to disrupt everyday life in cities across the world. However, African cities remain behind when it comes to adoption and utilization of such technologies and systems, citing the high level of risk involved.

Science and Technology Parks have become an established part of innovation infrastructure in many economies. The vision for these Science and Technology Parks is to develop a knowledge base and technical skill of communities for innovation growth in the economy.

The title of the paper is: The Role of Science and Technology Parks(STPs) and Areas of Innovation(AOIs) in promoting decentralized technologies in African cities. The paper seeks to argue that STPs and AOIs should play within a different technology and finacial regulatory framework, to provide an environment for experimentation with disruptive technologies such as Blockchain technology, before these solutions are rolled out at scale.

The paper delves into the conversation of the challenges facing African Cities, and residents, and the failing urbanization model. The narrative here is failing urban economic development. The paper also goes ahead to present a changing landscape of innovation globally based on Blockchain technology. Focus of the innovations are in three areas:

* Solutions for growth of African urban areas by improved investments
* Solutions for urban challenges in real life found on Blockchain
* Solutions for development of innovation and technology communities in African cities

Using global cities, African cities must take lessons on what to do and what not to do. As such, using global example, African cities can begin to understand their challenge and solution. Miami is a city with a population of about 6 million residents and a GDP of $151 billion. Nairobi is a city with a population of about 5 million residents and GDP of $15 billion. CityCoin, a Blockchain innovation just earned the city of Miami over $21 million in less that one year during the financial year 2021/2022. Think about the impact of such on economic density here in Nairobi.

The power of DAOs is also coming in very powerfully  and transforming how cities are build, owned, financed.

The theory is that African cities have low economic density ddue to the production of locally consumed goods and non-transferable goods and services that trap cities into low economic growth. This is further compounded by the 'Dutch Disease' which observes that cities relying on natural resources for growth often choke out other industries and sectors in the city since all services are directed to the natural resources.

If that is the case, then it is worth it to at least experiment with Blockchain technology and decentralized systems in the safely of STPs and AOIs as we seek solutions to the challenges facing African cities. STPs and AOIs need to act as sandboxes for urban development and growth in Africa.

Technology and innovations is today's global commodity and African cities are in critical need for these technologies and innovations.

That’s all for this week people.

类项目都有合理的市场价值和理性的市场估值，而且这类项目也并不需要多少营销成本，

体发这样的文章，用这样的舆论引导吓跑绝大多数啥都不懂的只会在二级市场投机炒b的
小白，也阻止了一部分资本的外流，政策上采用一刀切的方式也让这个人口众多文化认知
水平参差不齐的国家避免一些金融风险和社会不安定因素，同时让真正专业的一群先进时
代的领导者推动整个生态的健康发展，待各种基础设施完善好以后再象当初普及计算机和

后，真正的技术创新实用型项目才会一直延续下去，价值回归理性，到时候加密通证市值

区块链是极其复杂而先进到极致的领域，随着科学技术的发展而无限快速的进步，可以
无限扩展到工作生活和金融的方方面面，待量子传输通信普及之后所有非全球顶级公链的
普通网络都将面临量子危机，当然最终区块链也会扩展到整个宇宙和宇宙间各个文明接轨，
节点遍布宇宙间各个角落，量子传输通信消除了各个宇宙空间之间巨大的时差影响，另外
不管哪个文明毁灭，其一切数据和信息都依然永恒存在。
绝大多数只会炒b的投机者其实连门槛都还没入，基本的链上操作都不会，也不懂各种
专业的技术和代码，目前市场上乱象太多，很多普通投机者根本无法分辨真正做实事的有
先进技术创新的项目和传销诈骗空气项目，市面上很多都是copy别人的代码搞传销诈骗项
目，完全不干实事，甚至有的项目代码都懒得copy直接就是完全的空气项目仅仅只靠炒作
没有任何技术创新支撑.而且就算是真正做事的好项目也有合理的估值，并且同领域之间竞
争相当激烈，只有技术创新实力有绝对的优势才能长久在市场上立足占领该领域的龙头地
位，靠虚假宣传造势没有绝对优势的技术支撑只能短期骗骗小白，比如luna这个明显机制
和经济模型有问题的项目在我们专业的区块链人这里都是一目了然的，这个项目是百分百
不会长久的，但还是有这么多机构和小白投机者把它市值抬到如此夸张的地步，可见资本
的盲目性.当然这也是个人和机构赌徒们多方博弈的结果，市场也给了他们深刻的教训。当然
市场也会让他们变得越来越专业。
x to earn 模型的各类项目虽然大家都知道是传销而且没有任何底层技术协议创新的支
撑，玩的就是个概念和模式，但也很乐意去参与，毕竟这类项目都是早期参与者可以赚大
钱的，这十几年来各种传销项目都暴富了很大一批人，专业的投机者专门寻找有机会的传
销项目，非常清楚每一个各类机制的传销项目能走多长时间，可以在合适的时间退出，送
钱的基本都是啥都不懂的大爷大妈们和一些不理智的赌徒。
现在游戏和元宇宙金融（gamefi和metaverse）主要集中在NFT领域，虽然有所降温，
但依然比较活跃，技术创新上极少基本都很低级没有多少可玩性，大多数都是借助于区块
链和加密数字通证纯粹的炒作，不过在熊市中应该会诞生出真正务实创新革命性的项目，
在下个牛市成为整个领域的龙头。
目前区块链金融（defi）领域的赚钱效应也越来越小，最终利润率一定会回归理性和传
统金融靠拢，到时候所有基于智能合约的金融基础应用设施和协议也会更加完善。
区块链支付领域也在稳步发展之中，其中ACH在这个牛市中表现也比较亮眼。很多传统
支付领域的大佬也纷纷加入区块链领域比如paypal，币安交易所也早已布局了币安支付，待
其他基础设施和线下应用层面进一步完善也会角逐出区块链支付领域的龙头。
区块链域名和区块链存储领域的基础协议设施和应用上一直都在稳健的发展，待下个牛
市一定会迎来理性的价值回归。
区块链社交和创作者经济目前也才刚刚起步，web3时代的每个个体创作者都是一个自由
的公司dao组织，没有任何国家和平台能限制处理你的作品，作品制成NFT之后你自己也不能
对其进行删除，永恒保存在整个区块链网络文明之中。不再由任何平台赋予炒作和流量的价值
，价值的唯一体现是个人真正的内在价值。现在这个领域的竞争也是相当激烈，在这个熊市中
也会诞生出在区块链领域具有龙头地位的区块链微博，区块链微信qq，区块链推特和区块链
头条,youtube等等。

title: 区块建造模块化
body:
晓娜学习笔记 2022.6.28

学习资料来源：Bankless Podcast

写在前面：

本文是我的学习总结，受个人能力影响，这些观点可能是片面的甚至是错误的，如有发现还请大家及时指出，感谢各位！

以太坊正在朝向 Modular Blockchain 的方向努力，区块链的不可能三角问题似乎有解了。

大家都知道，以太坊很快 (9 月？) 将会有一件大事发生，就是合并 Merge。合并之后，以太坊的共识机制会从目前的 PoW 完全转为 PoS。但你可能不知道，merge 之后的区块建造也会采用模块化的方式。

## 这是什么意思呢？

目前 PoW 机制下，每个区块的建造完全由矿工负责，包括：

* 如何建造：对交易排序
* 建造
* 上链：把新区块连接上链形成新的区块链

合并之后，在 PoS 机制下，区块的建造将会由三个不同的角色分工完成：

* 如何建造：Searcher  
 Searcher 提供较复杂的排序方式，较复杂的排序往往涉及到 MEV，MEV 是让区块获得可能的最大价值的关键
* 建造：builder 
 Builder 负责 “搭砖盖房”，所有的奖励都会汇集给 Builder (区块奖励、小费、MEV 等)，他再分配给为建造这个有价值的区块做出贡献的人，如 searcher / Validator 等
* 上链：Validator  
 Validator 验证节点，我们都可以通过质押 ETH 参与

这三个角色有个共同的目标就是利益最大化，也就是让共同建造的这个区块的价值最大化。

你可能会有疑问了，这些都是技术大牛干的事情，跟我有什么关系？

没错，尤其是前两个角色跟我们普通用户似乎太遥远，但是通过质押 ETH 参与验证节点，为以太坊的安全做些贡献，这个事儿我们还是可以做的。

说到这里，有没有发现好玩的地方？

我们不懂 MEV，没有技术背景，但是这种模块化建造区块的方式，让我们也能够分享 MEV 专家、技术大神带来的价值收益。模块化让区块价值最大化。

除此之外，这样的模块化方式，意味着对验证节点的硬件要求会越来越低，去中心化程度也会越来越高。以后成为验证节点不再需要 32 个 ETH 甚至不需要 ETH 都是有可能的，我们就拭目以待咯！

合并带来的影响，ETH 质押的收益会有什么样的变化？我和 Bee 在 《谈东论西》的节目中做过讨论，有兴趣的朋友欢迎观看：

[https://youtu.be/i86RXvbQ1Ys](https://youtu.be/i86RXvbQ1Ys)

[https://youtu.be/rQxuPBy8tJg](https://youtu.be/rQxuPBy8tJg)

title: Magnety测试网
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/BYdwMK2ltvvj3ME7tsXV-.png?height=2582&width=2406)

**一、项目介绍**

Magnety 是一个基于 StarkNet 构建的链上资产管理协议，它允许任何人，如投资团体、DAO 或个人，通过一个易于使用的平台充分利用 DeFi，Magnety 充当协议聚合器。

**二、准备工作**

1、钱包：[Argent X](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/argent-x/dlcobpjiigpikoobohmabehhmhfoodbb) 或 [Braavos](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/braavos-wallet/jnlgamecbpmbajjfhmmmlhejkemejdma) 钱包（推荐使用这个钱包，目前社区里也在发放测试的角色，一一石二鸟） 
 2、领水：

1）Argent X Braavos 钱包 Goerli 领水：[网页链接](https://faucet.goerli.starknet.io/) 

2）Metamask Goerli 领水：[网页链接](https://faucet.paradigm.xyz/)，然后 Goerli 跨链(Metamask→Argent)：[跨链桥](https://goerli.starkgate.starknet.io/)

**三、测试步骤**

1、创建基金：打开[测试网](https://app.magnety.finance/)并连接钱包，点击“Monetize”按钮

2、配置基金：包括名称、头像、描述等，并选择配置的资产、选择交互的 DeFi 协议以及选择要交易的资产、设置Fee、设置总投资和基金货币的数量（这部分内容可任意填写）

3、创建基金：点击Greate my Fund

4、分享推特：单击“LFG”按钮转到Vault页面，点击分享到推特

5、频道反馈：将推特的链接发送到并提供反馈

[https://discord.gg/QFqeaupn](https://discord.gg/QFqeaupn)

速度很慢，要有耐心。

测试完毕。

title: Into the Abyss...
body:
If you are reading this at the time of publishing, and for some reason, you scour through my social media, you will notice that I have the same profile picture throughout my socials. No, it’s not because it’s an obscure NFT that I’m trying to promote, but rather a choice in the philosophical nature.

For those who haven’t played Dark Souls, allow me to introduce one of my favorite videogame characters: Knight Artorias, the Abysswalker. I’ll briefly summarize Artorias and how he is relevant to my social media presence and goals.

With the growing threat of the Abyss swallowing the kingdom whole, Lord Gwyn, king of Lordran, sends Artorias and his canine companion, Sif, on a quest to rid the world of the Abyss. Though the most skilled warrior in all the land, at the very heart of the Abyss, Artorias meets Manus, Father of the Abyss. Manus proves to be indomitable for Artorias. Before succumbing to the Abyss and his doom, Artorias casts a spell over Sif to protect it from the wretched Abyss. Sif is left for the player’s character, The Chosen Undead, to rescue, and the player is set to finish what the Abysswalker started, defeat Manus, and cast away the Abyss.

To me, the story of Artorias is one of the most interesting backstories of an NPC.

But why am I telling you this?

The crypto space can sometimes feel like an abyss. It feels like there’s too much to learn; everything moves fast, Bitcoin’s up, Bitcoin’s down, Bull market, Bear market… It can be a tad overwhelming to get in. This is especially true if your educational/previous career is not finance or tech-based.

This leads me to another bit of the philosophy of Dark Souls. “Git Gud” is something that may be infuriating to hear for frustrated gamers out here, but it is, in fact, a very reassuring line. To beat the game, all one has to do is “Git Gud.“ It doesn’t matter what level you are or even what leveled armor and weapons you have. If you don’t “Git Gud,“ you’re doomed to die endless deaths.

My goal is to implement this “Git Gud“ mentality, find possibly worthwhile DeFi/GameFi projects, and do a deep dive into what they are, who they are, and what they do. This provides me with a “hands-on” type of learning experience. Hopefully, I can provide some valuable information for you, my reader.

I am not, however, a financial expert. I am neither a software engineer nor an expert in blockchain technology. I want my readers to know this as I write more articles; I am not an expert. Please take what I say with a grain of salt.

I hope that through these analyses and updates, I may shed light on an otherwise abysmal dark forest of an ecosystem to whoever is willing to read and trek along with me on this journey.

Remember, git gud, and don’t you dare go hollow…

title: Airdrop Culture
body:
With the recent $OP & $HOP Airdrop hiccups & the criticism surrounding them, I figured it’s once again time to discuss some of the toxicity that seems increasingly more prevalent, especially in this current market. 

### Nurture Nature 

First of all, let’s talk about the fundamental nature of contemporary airdrops. If you’ve been around for a while you can skip the history lesson here. For neophytes to the space, understanding the genesis of the culture of retroactive airdrops can sometimes get lost in the noise. Though crypto airdrops have been around for sometime, the retro-reward governance model is usually credited as being started by Uniswap in 2020. Trying to maintain the continuity of decentralization was hardly anything new but, as anyone around in the ICO-boom days can attest, a better way was needed. The idea of giving ownership over to the very people who were already users & supporters seemed so simple, elegant, & fair. Though, as with all human endeavors, greed & exploitation followed swiftly.

### Only A Virgin Once

When Uniswap gave everyone who used V1 400 UNI tokens each, it was a total game-changer. It was unexpected to most & was also the last time a protocol would have the element of surprise at that level. Users began trying to anticipate if/when an airdrop would take place. The malicious sought ways to exploit airdrops for maximum financial gain. This is done most commonly through the “Sybil” attack. The practice of using multiple wallets to increase allocation of a potential airdrop. (*A reference to the book/film about a woman with multiple personalities.*) Because of this protocols have had to get creative with eligibility criteria. This always leads to complainoors complaining. 

### If You Don’t Want To Lose, Don’t Play

Anyone that has been here for more than a minute will tell you, the best strategy to qualify for airdrops is to actually be a user and/or contribute in some way. That said, gaming the system is something that people are always bound to try. If you choose to go that route though, you are gonna be disqualified frequently. In my (among many other’s) opinion this is tantamount to cheating & you forfeit the right to complain when you lose. It will be difficult to find a sympathetic ear anywhere. 

### A Rising Tide

The culture behind Web3 is one that seeks to stay inclusive, decentralized, & democratic. If you spend any length of time here & help build a few things you begin to understand why so many hold these ideals & strive to guard them at all costs. Do we always get it right? Not hardly, but we are trying to create something that is better & more fair than everything that came before. Everyone with pure intentions is welcome to join in. Try to add value to the space & I assure you, rewards will follow. 

[@erixink](https://twitter.com/erixink_)

title: SBT、DID、声誉/信用系统未发币潜力项目汇总
body:
**SBT：**

全称是“SoulBound Token”，直接翻译就是“灵魂绑定通证”。

SBT是一种可编程的、不可转让但可撤销与找回的，同时附带可验证信息的通证，类似一份不断扩展的个人简历，通过与其社会关系相关联的钱包进行验证。

这些拥有SBT的账户汇聚起来，就构成了DeSoc这样一个去中心化的社会。

**DID：**

**Decentralized Identity**（去中心化的身份）由传统的中心化身份衍化和派生出来，指去中介化，个人或组织完全拥有的自身数字身份的所有权，控制权以及管理权，将这部分权利完全归于用户自身。

如果DID（去中心化身份）被广泛采用，人们将能在穿梭不同的网络空间时，随身携带、展示完整的自我：无论在哪一个平台，人们在网络上创造、贡献、赚取和拥有的东西，都反映了他们的喜好和经验。这将使我们更接近物质世界中的运作方式——财产和声誉与我们自身有关，而不是平台，我们可以随身携带、随意使用。

**Reputation System：**

**Reputation System （声誉系统）**，在 a16z 的 Jad Esber & Scott Kominers 文章 《一种基于声誉系统的双代币经济模型 - A Novel Framework for Reputation-Based Systems 》 中提到“如果一个 Token 可以很容易地转移，那么那些没有声誉的人就可以简单地购买它，这降低了 Token 作为声誉信号的能力。” 使声誉 Token 可转让不仅会降低其作为声誉信号的能力，还会削弱其作为有价值补偿的能力。因此，建立声誉资本需要完全（或至少大部分）不可转让的 Token 。那么，问题是如何将声誉转化为流动性。

**未发币赛道项目：**

**1）SpruceID——DID、去中心化存储、基础设施**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zP-RwYocRCAoRbSsOp4Lf.png?height=697&width=1383)

Spruce 包含了两个产品，一个是去中心化身份工具包 SpruceID，另一个是用户自主存储空间 Kepler。

SpruceID 能在多条公链上使用，是一个跨平台的身份认证系统，它提供了签名、共享和验证可信信息。Spruce 已经与 Ethereum 基金会和 ENS 合作的登录 Ethereum (EIP-4361)，这是一个开放的标准和新的认证形式，允许用户连接 web2 或 Web3 应用程序，并直接使用他们的钱包钥匙 (不需要电子邮件地址) 控制他们的数字身份。举个例子，用户可以基于 SpruceID 的认证插件使用以太坊账户，直接登录 discord，不用二次信息验证。

在 Kepler 这个去中心化存储网络，它会围绕着用户自身数据「轨道」叠加。在在 Web3 中 s3 储存服务，也能做到 Web2 API 和 Web3 之间的互操作性。Kepler 让用户可以控制存储的关键方面: 从托管、访问到授权。

融资：

2021-11 ：筹集到 Ethereal Ventures 和 Electric Capital 牵头的 750 万美元的种子资金。

2022-04 ：宣布完成了 3400 万美元的融资，a16z 领投，Ethereal Ventures、 Electric Capital、 Robot Ventures 和 OrangeDAO等参投。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://spruceid.com/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/SpruceID)

**2）CyberConnect - 社交图谱、数据、基础设施**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6bRYNnIz4fPWUL_IoUQ_A.png?height=500&width=1500)

CyberConnect 是一个去中心化的社交图谱协议，为Web3.0社会网络和元宇宙服务。它的使命是将社交图谱数据的所有权和实用性还给用户，同时为所有的Web3.0开发者提供一个基础设施用以整合。

融资：

2021-11：宣布 1000 万美元的 种子轮融资，Multicoin Capital和Sky9 Capital共同领投。

2022-05:宣布 1500 万美元的 A 轮融资，Animoca Brands和Sky9 Capital共同领投。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://link3.to/cyberconnect)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/CyberConnectHQ)

3)**RabbitHole - 声誉系统、SBT、任务系统**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rYdfiZZERJfW1VqUC-iu-.png?height=500&width=1500)

RabbitHole旨在通过游戏化思维，将每个去中心化应用分解为游戏任务，引导用户与区块链协议、去中心化应用进行交互，培育DeFi用户的使用习惯，同时用户的 Web3 操作和行为还将获得认证。

通过管理用户以前的成就的链式图表，Rabbithole正在为未来的工作创建链式简历，并成为在Web3中寻找贡献者和发现工作的最佳场所，以及加密项目找到适合他们协议的最佳参与者，并轻松地引导他们的社区——从发现、入职、培训到规模。

融资：

2021-06:宣布完成360万美元种子轮融资，Electric Capital、ParaFi Capital、Framework Ventures等参投。

2022-02:宣布完成1800万美元A轮融资，由Greylock与TCG Crypto共同领投。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://rabbithole.gg/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/rabbithole_gg)

**4)NFT3 - DID、声誉系统**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qgBliX5mr1EidqfQ_tsxP.png?height=500&width=1500)

NFT3是一个用于Web3和元宇宙门户的去中心化身份和信用网络，设计了一个质押激励模型以应用于身份问题。它创造了Web 3.0中个人直接货币化路径，并为 Web 3.0 应用程序的复合级创作和创新提供了基础设施组件，它可以将用户条款价值与他们在不同项目、社交网络、公司和机构的生活中的数据联系起来。NFT3利用DID创建了Web3护照平台，并将创建用户个人信用评分系统。

NFT3将允许用户创建一个统一的身份，然后他们可以将其与任何 Web 3.0 应用程序相关联，以此解决虚拟身份的基本问题。这是通过创建用户拥有的 NFT 并将其包装在 DID 或分散标识符中来实现的，这些标识符可以在网络上传播，但始终返回到所有者的 NFT3。

融资：

2022-02:NFT3完成750万美元种子轮融资，Animoca Brands领投，DFG Group, CMS Holdings, LD Capital和Prometheus Labs Ventures参投。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://nft3.com/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/NFT3com)

5)**Spectral - 信用系统、无抵押借贷**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/52H3lU-IdmTO5yLRVJMwq.png?height=387&width=889)

Spectral是一个可编程信誉协议，通过信用风险分析促进链上的资本效率。作为一个完全可编程和可组合的金融基础，Spectral的信用评分允许无许可执行现有金融应用程序，如信用委托和证券化债务，并为利用链上交易历史建立用户信用的创新实施奠定基础。

Spectrum的第一款产品代表链上信用的MACRO（多资产信用风险预言机）评分，基于链上借贷历史、清算历史、欠款和偿还金额、信用组合和信用历史长度，为贷款人提供了一种改进的机制来评估借款人风险。

同时，Spectrum 引入了代表用户链上交易历史的不可替代信用 (NFC) 概念，NFC 允许用户捆绑钱包并将其链上交易历史同步到单个可组合资产 (erc-721)。MACRO 分数与 NFC 配对可产生一种新的可编程信用资产类别框架，作为可组合资产的链上交易历史在整个 web3 生态系统中引入了一种超越金融应用程序的新原语。

融资：

2021-11:宣布完成675万美元融资，Polychain Capital领投，Galaxy Digital、ParaFi Capital等参投。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://www.spectral.finance/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/SpectralFi)

6)**Union Finance：信用协议、SBT**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JPYl8z-St3T0f-6gIe4q-.png?height=731&width=1217)

Union Finance是部署在以太坊和Arbitrum上的一个信用协议，它使任何地址都能够以一种无需许可、加密原生的方式在链上积累信用额度，从而将信用协调为可用信贷的成本，为信誉良好但没有大量资产可用于抵押的DAO或个人等提供了借贷敞口，提升了资金的流动性。其代币UNION是使用Union协议获得的不可转让的SBT，不能被购买或出售，只具有治理权。

融资：

2020-12，宣布完成300万美元融资，投资机构包括Placeholder、1kx、CoinFund、Distributed Global、Spartan Group、Variant、Scalar、Defiance、Infinite Capital等。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://union.finance/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/unionprotocol)

7)**Sismo - 声誉系统、零知识证明**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2eQ5nh2VfqQs0y62ndr1n.png?height=500&width=1500)

Sismo 通过使用零知识证明向用户的其他帐户（如 ENS 以及 twitter 或 github）颁发徽章（NFT）来建立其以太坊个人资料，并且用户可以在保密的情况下将其声誉汇总到公开资料中。这种方法很新颖，因为它展示了零知识证明如何在下一个加密领域发挥作用。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://apply.workable.com/sismo-1/?lng=en)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/Sismo_eth)

**8)Context - 社交、NFT信息流**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/I1FLgr_GV6qJ8X21SL81h.png?height=589&width=1488)

Context 的愿景是为Web3创建一个社区驱动的Context层，允许用户通过类似Web2时代社交媒体的信息流监控其他人的钱包和交易。它还发布了产品的新版本，可以帮助用户自动找到与他们在Twitter上关注的人相关联的钱包。

融资：

4月14日，宣布完成1950万美元种子轮融资，本轮融资由Variant Fund和OpenAI首席执行官Sam Altman领投，Dragonfly Capital等参投。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://context.app/trending)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/context)

**9)Lens Protocol - 社交图谱**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/m36eagKrUjp6UXDj6INpA.png?height=500&width=1500)

Lens 是一个搭建在 Polygon 上，具有开源、可组合性的去中心化社交媒体底层协议（他们自称 Social Graph），具有一般的社交媒体功能，例如个人资料编辑、评论、转发帖子等。不同的是，Lens Protocol 由 NFT 提供支持，支持用户拥有和控制其所创作的所有内容。

Lens Protocol 的特点：

1\.内容、所有权通证化：用户的主页会被 Mint 为 Profile NFT 一直跟随用户，创作的内容也可以额外发行 NFT 出售给粉丝。

2\.组件模块化，允许开发者使用模块化组件在 Lens 上任意搭建自己的社交应用，鼓励开发者开发提升产品体验的新组件。外部其他应用也可以接入 Lens，并且共享 Lens 生态优势。

3\.还提供了 Market 行情查看、Exchange 交易功能、Save 存款管理、Pools 添加流动池、Borrow 借贷管理等功能。更像是一个 Back-end，而非前端产品。Lens protocol 更像是一个提供给各种社交媒体开发者的后台产品而非一个已经开发好的可以直接使用的前端产品。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://lens.xyz/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/LensProtocol)

**10)Violet Protocol - DID**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qn_6WEQgCeEQtXVMPUvZA.png?height=748&width=1575)

Violet 是一个建立在以太坊上的去中心化身份协议。我们正在建立一个工具链，在链上构成、表达和验证身份。个人和机构可以在其中维护合法的身份（KYC、AML、PEP 等）并使用其他链上和链下数据丰富它

Violet 正在建立一个链上基础设施产品，以解决机构的合规要求--同时最大限度地保护个人参与者的隐私。我们打算让DeFi建设者利用这一基础设施，因为他们开始参与机构流动性，并希望增加监管部门对其平台的信任。

融资：2021-08:宣布完成350 万美元的种子融资，由BlueYard Capital 领投

官网网站：[网页链接](https://violet.co/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/violetprotocol)

**11）Sublime - 信用系统**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sqjE32YmIiSRSTNv6UY-N.png?height=478&width=907)

Sublime与典型的信用检查不同，Sublime将让用户利用他们的数字身份来获得抵押不足的贷款。除了社交媒体资料外，Sublime还将支持加密和NFT作为抵押品。

融资：2021-10：宣布完成250万美元种子轮融资，Galaxy Digital和Electric Capital领投，FinTech Collective、Collab+Currency和天使投资人Jill Carlson Gunter和Ryan Selkis参投。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://sublime.finance/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/sublimefinance)

**12）Atem Network - 社交协议**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZMpt9Ze9104pt4jB76DHv.png?height=500&width=1500)

Atem 是一个基于 NFT 的群组社交平台，旨在通过 NFT 把用户连接起来，探索基于 NFT 的社交网络，并丰富 NFT 资产与持有者，以及持有者彼此之间的关系表达。Atem 平台上的群组基于个人拥有的 Token 或 NFT 形成，并与交易实现无缝结合。用户根据自己持有的 NFT，可以很方便的进入各种各样的社群里，并可以很方便的和群里的人讨论，或进行点对点交易。

融资：2022-02：宣布完成 300 万美元种子轮融资，INCE Capital 领投。GSR Ventures、Mask Network、Mirana Ventures、A&T Capital、Atlas Capital、Foresight Ventures、Zonff Partners 以及知乎联合创始人 Michael Zhang 参投。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://www.atem.io/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/atem_network)

**13）Dework - 任务系统**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/x4XK59C6H--Xx5rrf-Uoq.png?height=450&width=1248)

Dework 是一种 Web 3 原生协作工具，去中心化自治组织 （DAO） 可以在其中组织内部和外部团队，以透明的方式管理任务和奖励，并帮助新成员加入，他们希望成为 Web3 领域里的 Trello 和 LinkedIn。

融资：完成 500 万美元的种子轮融资，本轮融资由 Paradigm 和早期风险投资公司 Pace Capital 联合领投，Coinbase 前首席技术官 Balaji Srinivasan 和 Polygon 创始人 Sandeep Nailwal 等参投。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://dework.xyz/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/deworkxyz)

**14）Reputation DAO - 信用系统**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/V6nK5Z2zhRv9AJiTUnTtX.png?height=500&width=1500)

Reputation DAO 是一种可验证、去中心化和可编程的 DeFi 信用评分系统，它可以映射链下数据，如 AML/KYC、传统信用评分和社交媒体数据，为 Chainlink 预言机、DAO、智能合约协议及其用户提供可信的中立信用服务，使个人能够在与智能合约交互时利用其真实世界的金融数据和身份，以增强对特定账户风险指标的评估，并减少抵押贷款流程。

融资：2022-04：宣布获475 万美元融资，DACM、AirTree Ventures、 Koji Capital 和 Framework Ventures等参投。其中Chainlink联合创始人Sergey Nazarov作为顾问加入Reputation DAO。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://reputation.link/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/ReputationDAO)

**15）ARCx - 声誉系统**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/DRifvAkrotYKYs0LJSaMT.png?height=775&width=1362)

ARCx是一个去中心化声誉协议，允许用户在去中心化金融世界中通过他们的链上行为释放利益。ARCx通过处理和评分大量数据，然后将其上传到用户的Passport（不可转让的NFT）来实现这一点。

ARCx根据每个 DeFi Passport 持有者的信用分来量化其链上地址的信誉度。信用分将通过分析持有者的以太坊地址历史活动来确定，其范围设置为 0 到 999 分，该信用分确定了协议为用户提供的抵押率。在申领 Passport 后，用户会受到激励，通过在多个“游戏”中最大化自己的分数来提高自己的链上声誉，这样他们就可以获得各种好处，例如以更低的抵押率进行借贷。

ARCx通过为参与者提供一种无信任的方式来建立声誉体系，并为其他协议和平台提供一种机制来识别、奖励和进一步激励良好声誉，从而为web3服务。

融资：2021-06：宣布完成 130 万美元融资，Dragonfly Capital、Scalar Capital 和 Ledger Prime 领投

官网网站：[网页链接](https://arcx.money/passport)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/arcxmoney)

**16）Atlendis Protocol - 信用系统、无抵押借贷**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/K-Ct1nEfzlXLjbCe1ACUt.png?height=540&width=1228)

Atlendis Protocol是由Atlendis Labs开发的无抵押借贷协议，以解决目前超额抵押资金效率较低的问题。对于借款方（如Dapp、DAO等），Atlendis Protocol首先会进行审查，只有获得白名单的才有借款的资格，其次，贷款方可以自定义借贷利率以及借款人，将可能获得比传统超额抵押借贷协议更高的APR。

Atlendis Protocol的灵感来自于2021年以太坊全球MarketMake黑客松，在2021年4月由ConsenSys的4位同事创立。

融资：2021-12：Atlendis Protocol宣布完成440万美元的种子轮融资，由Lemniscap领投，参投方包括ParaFi Capital、Tioga Capital、White Star Capital、DeFiance Capital、True Ventures、Digital Currency Group、Divergence Ventures等。

官网网站：[网页链接](https://atlendis.io/)

官方推特：[网页链接](https://twitter.com/AtlendisLabs)

title: novel net art thesis(rough draft)
body:
listen while reading:

https://soundcloud.com/p-r-i-m-e-c-u-l-t/sets/iudhsgwldoru

Some of the most beautiful and haunting images ever seen exist in certain corners of the internet. But what exactly is the source? Why do these images speak to our heart and stick in our mind when others don’t?

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GETfJBDB-ZJZ5LTbURjAk.jpg?height=1162&width=1170)

Novel net art has certain characteristics that make it so alluring. Good example of this is everything-at-once drained-out internet-as-a-dream edits that have seen boost in popularity over last 2 years.¹ Its what happens to the liminal space when the liminal space no longer attempts to tether itself to reality.²

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9yP15NGn6WE682MUSPP6K.jpg?height=1452&width=1170)

Perception: something we do subconsciously, all the time, to everything we look at, no exceptions. To understand why novel net art is unique we must look at what exactly the process of perception is.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zJ7c37wmgYf5VKBqYCkqo.jpg?height=1215&width=2048)

When we look at something we are used to breaking it down into parts. When we look at a bed we see “pillow” “sheets” “trusty pistol within arms reach” . But before that, there is a moment, a moment before perception when everything is one, a moment of pre-perception Unity before the Scalpel of Reason steps in and cuts and categorizes and identifies everything into neat little digestible elements. God lives in that moment of pre-perception (maybe other more malevolent entities do too, im not sure). In that moment everything is unified, and all rational cognition is downstream from that moment

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/R0yec3OhJUCxjL8nTC8z4.jpg?height=1448&width=1170)

Back to avant net art. this art is aesthetically jarring, the distortion  and overlapping elements diffuses citation and disorients the viewer.  This brief moment of disorientation allows the art to hijack that  crucial moment of pre-perception and extend it out so we can swim in it a  bit. We look at the art piece and try to go about the usual process of  perception but – if the artist is skilled enough – the process is  interrupted and we exist in the pre-perception moment for much longer  than usual.³

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/87Ymz3FUHZ4l1AMF1QIYM.jpg?height=1117&width=1170)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rTwQWeIOSc4N9DxeIQE9p.jpg?height=1162&width=1170)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/x4lK35QckkfcWJCRQ2O3-.jpg?height=1168&width=1170)

The best art is that which utilizes aesthetics to convey a Truth - and  novel net art is no different. This art strikes a chord because we are  finally being honest about what the internet really is. Its the abyss,  the void, its Heaven, its dreamscape, its what you see when you close  your eyes. You don’t see your phone in your dreams because you’re  looking through the window, not at it.  We’re finally being honest. When  you log on, your psyche enters the realm of the Qliphoth, wherein you  are at the mercy of its residents.Were finally being honest. This art  proves it.  We’re finally being honest.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ofALCRpQF1iM1LTtMMtOD.jpg?height=1159&width=1170)

One day we wont need computers to log on

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mhm0_hix6nV4At-AYfLli.jpg?height=1161&width=1170)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VPmm7ntCZCQsBBqWGi0jy.jpg?height=1169&width=1170)

1. these examples incorporate dreamcore angelcore webcore etc, surge/hexd style album art, also hypergeometric elements, ssnargecore etc. not prudent to derail over which examples may or may not belong to a specific (in)correctly labeled subgenre. The purpose of this article is to analyze a phenomenon between certain pieces of digital art and the viewer during the process of viewing, which occurs across a spectrum of underground digital art subgenres. While a comprehensive history of how these subgenres came to be and how each subculture informed each other would be fascinating and is sorely needed, it is outside the scope of this article. For the purposes of exploring this phenomenon, the umbrella term “novel net art” will suffice.
2. it could be argued that instead of a relatively straightforward photo *of* a liminal space, the images *themselves* function as a liminal space within the digital real estate of ur screen. but i could be reaching.
3. this phenomenon can happen with the written word too, see angelicism

title: 于我而言，新手做合约最重要的三件事（一点五）
body:
这篇主要是对于上篇的一些“玄学”的解释。

虽说是解释，一定程度上也是 “用魔法解释魔法”。

前面讲到了价格时常会在固定的区域进行来回波动，在接近边缘的时候会有反弹。听起来这好像特别主观——人为设定的框框影响了市场的走势。

其实这也没有错，主观能动性一直是市场很重要的一部分，我个人是这么认为的。毕竟一个人的主观判断是臆测，一群人的主观判断就是市场情绪了。加密货币（至少目前为止）的确是人赋予他的价值大于它们实际的应用价值。

那么从另一个角度，较为客观的角度去聊一下为什么价格会在一些范围，或者前高、前低等特殊位置有明显的反应（止跌、止涨、来回波动）呢？这就跟这个听起来很高级的名词 **liquidity** 有关了。

liquidity中文直译为流动性，不太好理解。一位不愿透露姓名的圈内前辈狐狸君给了我一个比较好理解的解释。 
 What does the fox say? 
 流动性充足的点你可以理解为，**我想要建仓的位置**。 
 所以又回到了上一篇说的主题，入场的时机。

经常会看到有大佬在拉盘/砸盘的时候，丢出一张图说，这波杀多/杀空。

![借用Quantitative Trading的Morty大大的图](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vaG8b9KMaE91Yfm0TpC0L.png?height=1234&width=2708)

 
 你是否也和我一样有过这样的想法：“这帮庄是不是有猫病啊，一起赚钱不好吗，偏要砸盘赶我下车，有病吧？” 
 这对于没有任何金融、经济、市场知识的我来说，还是一个需要花点时间去思考的问题，我得出的比较简单，但不一定准确的答案如下：

1. 因为在特定的区域，是许多人的止损点，这部分区域流动性相对更强，更容易成单换手。
2. 大幅度砸盘/拉盘过后，有些人的仓位被打止损，造成短时间内，区域性的流动性真空。这个时候庄家在韭菜止损后建立了仓位，再试图往上拉/往下砸，车会更轻。

来举个比较有想象画面（也比较理想化）的例子，帮助理解。（数据都为随意抓取的）

韭菜和我：

 1. 我和推特上几乎所有人都认为，19500是近期BTC的底部。
 2. 我们在价格回调到20000的时候，因为害怕错过上车，买入BTC并开了多。
 3. 我们为了安全起见，“机智地”将止损放在了19000，给自己留一点空间。而且19200还是上一轮牛市的顶点，肯定很多人在这里有支撑。
 4. 此时如果BTC价格到了19000，那么你将会以19000的价格将手上的仓位全部关掉，即卖出BTC at 19000。
 5. 我操，还有更低，亏了。（此时价格20000 → 19500）
 6. 完了。（现价19025）
 7. 打到止损19000，被迫卖出，进一步砸低价格。（止损、爆仓一般以市价卖出）
 8. 一切都完了，亏完了，没想到砸穿了上轮顶点，币圈完了。（18000-18500）
 9. 你好，美团外卖吗，我想应聘。
10. 开始做多的&后来追空的：区块链骗局，cnm。没上车的韭菜：不敢动，不敢动。

庄家和机构：

 1. 这帮人情绪到位了，认为跌无可跌了。
 2. 先把盘压一压，让没建仓的以为自己机会来了，给他们抄底的机会。
 3. 他们在20000建仓了，按照5%的止损，他们的止损大概在19000左右；况且上轮牛的顶点就在19000，肯定很多人刻舟求剑。
 4. 在18000-18500左右建仓。
 5. 砸盘，现价19500。
 6. 加大力度，现价19025。
 7. 差不多了，等待。（韭菜19000止损平仓，散户各种卖出，价格随之继续下跌）
 8. 仓位建起来了，多单接到了。（现价18000-18500）。
 9. 由于刚才跌的太快，在车上的被止损了，没上车的在观望，因此20000-18000之间的挂单相对少了很多，此时即便是上涨，散户手里的筹码不够多了，砸不下来。**庄家开始加大买入，同时散户开始追空。**由于车轻，散户根本无法对抗庄家，价格一下反弹起来，直接越过18000-20000的真空，回到21500。
10. 情绪到位了，准备开启牛市。庄家：先打高尔夫去吧。

很多地方由于文笔和认知问题，解释地不是特别好，以后再慢慢补充、改动。

title: HopExchange交互教程##奥德赛活动
body:
**相关地址：**

[https://app.hop.exchange/#/send](https://app.hop.exchange/#/send)

[https://galaxy.eco/arbitrum/campaign/GCCNzUtQiW](https://galaxy.eco/arbitrum/campaign/GCCNzUtQiW)

**交互简介：**

最近奥德赛活动比较火，大家关注度非常高，第一周的任务是跨链桥，通过任何官方指定的桥，就能获得NFT的资格。另外交互过使用频次最高的桥，将会获得额外的一张额外的NFT。网上大家对HopExchange的呼声很高。因此关于HopExchange的保姆级教程来了。

**交互概览：**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c4tFCQ0x_Wp4U8sxy2Agh.png?height=1233&width=1182)

**交互说明：**

首先打开HopExchange的官网

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/F9Z0GlahbMWk9fEi12X-9.png?height=1786&width=2076)

接着点击connect a wallet

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E4HMLO9YU4sLnUYyVHloM.png?height=1770&width=2088)

选择metamask进行授权，授权后即可进行交易。

选择

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rr1Meesmh7DjDkhZnOKcH.png?height=1747&width=1850)

初始公链，输入需要跨链的币种，这里是从ETH主网跨链到Arbitrum网络。（我在ETH网络上有余额）。当选择主网和币种输入需要跨链的数量，平台会计算出到到账数量，点击send。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_C2E-mdiyp5rbjl2gxiSI.png?height=882&width=1638)

此时页面会出现metamsak的授权页面。点击confirm进行确认。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/l_1qn9wi52WYOOVb2UV3p.png?height=875&width=516)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yHZbwT2IQu2_dxbZAav92.png?height=561&width=865)

授权后，页面将展示跨链的状态，只需等待即可，一般需要花4～5分钟。

当token跨链成功后，在project galaxy可以看到NFT的领取状态。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/afAfzoTPvoQ2VNKi8QRXs.png?height=1828&width=1894)

在奥德赛期间，使用HOP的用户，可以领取HOP的NFT。领取地址如下：

[https://galaxy.eco/HopProtocol/campaign/GCmydUtumN](https://galaxy.eco/HopProtocol/campaign/GCmydUtumN)

当前总结：随着宏观层面的博弈，资金量并没有更多的转移近币市，甚至今天的资金量已经达到了令人发指的低点，这也是BTC和ETH在持续下跌的原因，毕竟拼到了最后，看的都是资金。尤其是今天出现了较多的大笔转移的情况，尤其是转移到了交易所的抛压，这不能排除是屯币大户离场的可能。

Twitter @Phyrex_Ni

截止到今天早晨九点的BTC持仓价格分布，从昨天美股开盘到现在的数据，周末的时候流量已经低至了将近冰点，而美股开盘前就已经出现了相对较大量的BTC链上地址变化，所以对于今天的转移数据已经有了心理准备，从两边的极端价格来看，远古持仓的筹码并没有太大的变化，依然是在常规范围之内。

而高位套牢的BTC却出现了大量的提升，主要是在58,000美金左右离场的3,000枚BTC，而且通过数据对比，这批高位套牢的筹码这次很有可能是直接转移到交易所变成了抛压。除此以外22,000美金上方的亏损筹码也已经从周末的状态变回了常规工作日的状态，发生转移的筹码开始大增。

但需要注意的是，目前的变化筹码的增加并不是所有价位的离场筹码都在提升，而是个别价格的BTC出现了较大规模的转移情况，这种情况往往代表了一个团体或者是持仓大户的发生的变化，也就是说当前的价格和流通性已经开始在影响屯币的大户，毕竟经过一次次的下跌后散户持有的筹码已经所剩无几。

在亏损筹码的减持中26,000美金至31,000美金之间大量堆积的筹码减持依然并不是很多，到现在仍然持有超过130万枚BTC，而这次的减持主力也是这个阶段的筹码。另一个需要注意的地方是20,000美金附近的筹码堆积已经来到了次高点，存量高达77万枚。这种情况在最近三个月也发生了两次。

一次是发生在40,000美金的堆积，一次是发生在30,000美金的堆积，而这两次的结果都是因为大量的堆积而导致了价格短时间的崩溃，毕竟当一个价位的筹码过多，但价格又表现出下行的情况下，堆积的筹码很有可能为了避免损失的扩大而选择直接砸盘离场，这也是短时间将BTC价格打下来的主要原因。

而到现在为止的历史上唯一一个没有崩溃的大量堆积BTC是在3,400美金左右，即便是到现在还堆积有超过86万枚BTC，而20,000美金的价格的堆积能否逃离崩溃的结局目前还不得而知，但如果宏观局面继续恶化下去，资金持续减少，很难不会出现一次较深的插针情况。毕竟这种堆积量随时可以在筑底和抛压间切换。

通过转移到交易所的BTC可以看到，今天的转移量相比上周的平均值都有所提升了，其中最大的原因是在今天凌晨出现了单笔超过22,000枚BTC的转移，转移的目标交易所是Gemini，时间是在北京时间的凌晨5点50分，应该是获利筹码的离场。但因为数据太多没有仔细一一检查，有兴趣的小伙伴可以自己查查。

而相对于突然增高的抛压来说，昨天的资金并没有强盛到如此的地步，毕竟宏观的数据并没有任何的好转，所以购买力被较大程度的甩在了后边，也是近期少有的购买力低于抛压的情况，看来，果然就如同昨天晚上说的，面对拉盘，起床的美国人还是做出了抛售的选择。

首此影响可以看到交易所的BTC存量有了较大的提升，就是这2万枚筹码带来的结果，直接将交易所的存量提升到一周以前的库存，这还是因为今天早晨出现了一笔较大的转出减少了库存的最大值，否则存量会更多。

相比于已经遭到抛压阻击的BTC来说，目前ETH的情况是更加的不如，即在Gemini出现了大量的转入BTC后，依然是Gemini出现了高达16万枚ETH的转入抛压，而且在时间上也是一样，其中并不排除有BTC和ETH互转实现同步出货的情况，尤其是目前的ETH仍然处于大量堆积的情况，堆积量已经超过四月库存。

虽然目前ETH的成交量继续和BTC咬的很紧，但是资金量还是以BTC为主，面对更大抛压的时候BTC的资金都不够，就不用说ETH了，同样也是转出的提现大于转入的抛压，看来更多的筹码都在等ETH的合并，也不知道合并和阶段性的崩溃那个先来。总的来说，目前的ETH就是一颗可能会提前爆炸的定时炸弹。

其实从BTC和ETH出现购买力不敌抛压的情况就可以预想到资金的问题，果不其然，开盘第一天的资金量几乎跌到了谷底，甚至以为昨天是假期了，一直是购买力担当的USDT截止到今天早晨八点的资金量仅仅是上半年周末的资金量，甚至还不足。完全不像开盘第一天的数据，由此可以知道做空USDT对购买力的影响。

相比USDT，虽然USDC在数据上好看一些，但是USDC的实际购买力还是不够强，而整体的资金短缺也是使得今天早晨开始BTC和ETH下跌的原因，而只要宏观的情况无法得到好转，那么资金量必然会越来越少，对于币市的打击也会越来越大，和美股的脱钩也会逐渐出现，但是这种脱钩并没有任何的好处。

从近48小时资金与抛压的细节数据就可以看到目前的比例情况是多么的夸张，资金已经处于严重不足的情况，并且单笔大量的抛压出现的频率开始增加，不论是BTC还是ETH都会遇到这样的问题。

从BTC的永续合约数据来看，资金费率的显示已经是在较大规模的看空了，如果还可以继续维持看空状态的话，确实是不错的建仓时机，尤其是在所有指标都失灵的现自，资金费率的建仓方案依然是保持着100%的准确率，所以可以多关注一下。而未平合约也越挫越勇的继续向高位进发。

话题还要说一下最近又出现的USDT做空的新闻，从昨天晚上开始就陆陆续续的有小伙伴来问我，实际上这条新闻已经是将近2个月前的事情了，只是最近又开始炒作起来而已，但实际上从Tether宣布新一轮的审计开始后，其实USDT的市值仅仅减持了1亿美金，想象中的大规模挤兑依然没有出现，而USDC的市值也没有增加。

就目前的情况来看，做空USDT的可能性还是太低，一个半月将近170亿美金的承兑没有出现任何的负面新闻，我相信很多银行都做不到。当然还有很多小伙伴说这已经是Tether的极限了，对此我也没什么可说的了，反正觉得不安全就换USDC吧，起码汇率上的损失已经越来越少，而目前又是一个用汇率说话的时代。

title: Espresso 交互教程
body:
## 项目背景：

Espresso目的是建立一个可扩展的web3隐私解决方案,目前由红杉资本领投$3200W。现在还处于非常早期阶段，值得一做。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/l0raK9RlDn-alaJmTj4u-.png?height=714&width=1270)

### 本次教程需要搭建VMware虚拟机环境，并安装ubuntu

推荐用腾讯的软件中心下载VMware，因为官网在国外，下载速度很慢。

[腾讯软件中心](https://pc.qq.com/detail/0/detail_21600.html)

下载完成后，按照文章安装搭建步骤很详细。文章是两年前的文章，VMware版本还是14，现在是16，都是一样安装。

[虚拟机安装教程](https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/141033713)

搭建好虚拟机和系统后，再安装Docker

[docker安装教程](https://kalacloud.com/blog/how-to-install-and-use-docker-on-ubuntu)

docker成功安装之后，执行

`docker-compose pull`

如果报错：docker-compose 命令不存在，则进行安装

`sudo apt install docker-compose`

安装完成继续执行

`sudo docker-compose pull`

按Y等待安装完成，接着执行

`sudo docker-compose up`

出现如下结果，则为成功

![钱包运行成功](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bBBzf4eVDSkkprfBPS0gP.png?height=720&width=1748)

现在可以在浏览器内URL栏打开：localhost，就能看到钱包在运行

![钱包启动界面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yQ0VYDoH2Zg1Z5rSq6Oj7.png?height=658&width=1279)

至此，前期准备工作全部完成，开始真正的测试：

**1.设置新钱包**

![新钱包](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g2r-KDZzXg7vKbo3fRM3y.png?height=641&width=1279)

2\.点击“**reveal keys**”保存助记词，将自己的助记词妥善保存，之后可用于恢复钱包

**3.命名钱包恢复文件**

![命名](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nEhXp14VUvXlFZAngHlBu.png?height=885&width=1275)

**4.设置钱包密码**

![设置密码](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rREZ8igEvKu19tFjIPGzf.png?height=879&width=1278)

**5.创建钱包**

![创建钱包](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PO0tdY9c5xpoiAphL1iTL.png?height=856&width=1261)

**6.领取测试代币**

![领取测试币](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dEDUXCNKz7F2Q6BKAGaph.png?height=885&width=1290)

**7.回到首页，连接钱包，注意要切换到goerli链**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/i2JIc0xvmnT1I4mz38aox.png?height=1025&width=1276)

由于本次使用虚拟机安装Ubuntu进行测试，浏览器没有小狐狸钱包，所以使用手机钱包(本人手机钱包为TP钱包)进行连接，效果一样。不过首先得添加goerli链，和电脑上大致相同，钱包内打开[Chainlist](https://chainlist.info/)，搜索goerli添加上即可。

或者直接在浏览器里安装小狐狸然后倒入助记词也是可以的。

![手机连接钱包](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GtWyiknamWG9jfKrZcbLa.jpg?height=2532&width=1170)

**8.到“Account”页面生成一个新钱包地址**

![新地址](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2RP_HxiiVnfTlcXfH10vC.png?height=790&width=1546)

**9.发送一些代币到新钱包地址**

![发送代币](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/UOdJkW4Man-VlHfDQFmN6.png?height=938&width=1521)

**10.创建新的ERC-20资产**

![添加新资产](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dyAbUp-X4RN6T146Ez4Mh.png?height=888&width=1541)

goerli有余额的代币合约，可以去[ethscaner](https://goerli.etherscan.io/)里搜索自己钱包，然后查看有余额的代币，图中所示就是你钱包里的代币余额。选取第一个然后复制代币合约填入上述页面即可。

![代币余额](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LSyBGkCk9oPWRAve9QGcW.png?height=1199&width=2334)

填入第一个代币ATOM的合约地址

![添加合约](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vTL6XbuU6eOPUkTcjrTsW.png?height=1014&width=1532)

往下拉，我们会看到还有两个信息需要填写

![两个key](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3m8Aj6td1I3uBfWgD80o8.png?height=1017&width=1516)

一个是**viewing key**，另一个**freezing key，**这俩信息需要在“**Account**”页面生成

![viewing key](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/i85P34hRv3tQsvUNvd0gP.png?height=694&width=1570)

![freezing key](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/s0duekPz3H2VeBP1YA-sg.png?height=743&width=1577)

然后将这俩key保存，并填入到刚才的资产页面，注意选项都勾选上，然后点击创建。需要等待几分钟

![填入key](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VnvCSgsqHG7Tua54-2wjj.png?height=1024&width=1600)

其实如果不需要在“资产查看密钥”和“资产冻结密钥”部分选择启用查看交易金额和交易地址，以及启用该资产类型的交易冻结。可以不用勾选后面选项也可以生成新资产。

![新资产](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eQQdFULy5IF5cJlkKP5Es.png?height=1114&width=1700)

查看新的资产信息

![新资产信息](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Q0ESgABII3uDEA6UwOrJc.png?height=1141&width=1835)

**11.导出或导入新的资产**

但你自己创建了一个新的资产时，你可以导出资产信息方便别人导入；当你想看到他人的资产信息时，直接导入他人资产的信息即可；

![导入导出资产信息](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TSHXlhGMpGCOJIWBqL52o.png?height=1121&width=2015)

**12.Wrap和Unwrap资产**

找到目标资产进行操作即可。但测试中授权一直没成功，后续再看

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6bkFyMriQ59okURi-KNbF.png?height=1193&width=1752)

title: 资金继续大幅度下降 BTC&ETH均遭遇到抛压阻击 存量上升 — 2022.6.28
body:
### 

 
 

当前总结：随着宏观层面的博弈，资金量并没有更多的转移近币市，甚至今天的资金量已经达到了令人发指的低点，这也是BTC和ETH在持续下跌的原因，毕竟拼到了最后，看的都是资金。尤其是今天出现了较多的大笔转移的情况，尤其是转移到了交易所的抛压，这不能排除是屯币大户离场的可能。

Twitter @Phyrex_Ni

截止到今天早晨九点的BTC持仓价格分布，从昨天美股开盘到现在的数据，周末的时候流量已经低至了将近冰点，而美股开盘前就已经出现了相对较大量的BTC链上地址变化，所以对于今天的转移数据已经有了心理准备，从两边的极端价格来看，远古持仓的筹码并没有太大的变化，依然是在常规范围之内。

而高位套牢的BTC却出现了大量的提升，主要是在58,000美金左右离场的3,000枚BTC，而且通过数据对比，这批高位套牢的筹码这次很有可能是直接转移到交易所变成了抛压。除此以外22,000美金上方的亏损筹码也已经从周末的状态变回了常规工作日的状态，发生转移的筹码开始大增。

但需要注意的是，目前的变化筹码的增加并不是所有价位的离场筹码都在提升，而是个别价格的BTC出现了较大规模的转移情况，这种情况往往代表了一个团体或者是持仓大户的发生的变化，也就是说当前的价格和流通性已经开始在影响屯币的大户，毕竟经过一次次的下跌后散户持有的筹码已经所剩无几。

在亏损筹码的减持中26,000美金至31,000美金之间大量堆积的筹码减持依然并不是很多，到现在仍然持有超过130万枚BTC，而这次的减持主力也是这个阶段的筹码。另一个需要注意的地方是20,000美金附近的筹码堆积已经来到了次高点，存量高达77万枚。这种情况在最近三个月也发生了两次。

一次是发生在40,000美金的堆积，一次是发生在30,000美金的堆积，而这两次的结果都是因为大量的堆积而导致了价格短时间的崩溃，毕竟当一个价位的筹码过多，但价格又表现出下行的情况下，堆积的筹码很有可能为了避免损失的扩大而选择直接砸盘离场，这也是短时间将BTC价格打下来的主要原因。

而到现在为止的历史上唯一一个没有崩溃的大量堆积BTC是在3,400美金左右，即便是到现在还堆积有超过86万枚BTC，而20,000美金的价格的堆积能否逃离崩溃的结局目前还不得而知，但如果宏观局面继续恶化下去，资金持续减少，很难不会出现一次较深的插针情况。毕竟这种堆积量随时可以在筑底和抛压间切换。

通过转移到交易所的BTC可以看到，今天的转移量相比上周的平均值都有所提升了，其中最大的原因是在今天凌晨出现了单笔超过22,000枚BTC的转移，转移的目标交易所是Gemini，时间是在北京时间的凌晨5点50分，应该是获利筹码的离场。但因为数据太多没有仔细一一检查，有兴趣的小伙伴可以自己查查。

而相对于突然增高的抛压来说，昨天的资金并没有强盛到如此的地步，毕竟宏观的数据并没有任何的好转，所以购买力被较大程度的甩在了后边，也是近期少有的购买力低于抛压的情况，看来，果然就如同昨天晚上说的，面对拉盘，起床的美国人还是做出了抛售的选择。

首此影响可以看到交易所的BTC存量有了较大的提升，就是这2万枚筹码带来的结果，直接将交易所的存量提升到一周以前的库存，这还是因为今天早晨出现了一笔较大的转出减少了库存的最大值，否则存量会更多。

相比于已经遭到抛压阻击的BTC来说，目前ETH的情况是更加的不如，即在Gemini出现了大量的转入BTC后，依然是Gemini出现了高达16万枚ETH的转入抛压，而且在时间上也是一样，其中并不排除有BTC和ETH互转实现同步出货的情况，尤其是目前的ETH仍然处于大量堆积的情况，堆积量已经超过四月库存。

虽然目前ETH的成交量继续和BTC咬的很紧，但是资金量还是以BTC为主，面对更大抛压的时候BTC的资金都不够，就不用说ETH了，同样也是转出的提现大于转入的抛压，看来更多的筹码都在等ETH的合并，也不知道合并和阶段性的崩溃那个先来。总的来说，目前的ETH就是一颗可能会提前爆炸的定时炸弹。

其实从BTC和ETH出现购买力不敌抛压的情况就可以预想到资金的问题，果不其然，开盘第一天的资金量几乎跌到了谷底，甚至以为昨天是假期了，一直是购买力担当的USDT截止到今天早晨八点的资金量仅仅是上半年周末的资金量，甚至还不足。完全不像开盘第一天的数据，由此可以知道做空USDT对购买力的影响。

相比USDT，虽然USDC在数据上好看一些，但是USDC的实际购买力还是不够强，而整体的资金短缺也是使得今天早晨开始BTC和ETH下跌的原因，而只要宏观的情况无法得到好转，那么资金量必然会越来越少，对于币市的打击也会越来越大，和美股的脱钩也会逐渐出现，但是这种脱钩并没有任何的好处。

从近48小时资金与抛压的细节数据就可以看到目前的比例情况是多么的夸张，资金已经处于严重不足的情况，并且单笔大量的抛压出现的频率开始增加，不论是BTC还是ETH都会遇到这样的问题。

从BTC的永续合约数据来看，资金费率的显示已经是在较大规模的看空了，如果还可以继续维持看空状态的话，确实是不错的建仓时机，尤其是在所有指标都失灵的现自，资金费率的建仓方案依然是保持着100%的准确率，所以可以多关注一下。而未平合约也越挫越勇的继续向高位进发。

话题还要说一下最近又出现的USDT做空的新闻，从昨天晚上开始就陆陆续续的有小伙伴来问我，实际上这条新闻已经是将近2个月前的事情了，只是最近又开始炒作起来而已，但实际上从Tether宣布新一轮的审计开始后，其实USDT的市值仅仅减持了1亿美金，想象中的大规模挤兑依然没有出现，而USDC的市值也没有增加。

就目前的情况来看，做空USDT的可能性还是太低，一个半月将近170亿美金的承兑没有出现任何的负面新闻，我相信很多银行都做不到。当然还有很多小伙伴说这已经是Tether的极限了，对此我也没什么可说的了，反正觉得不安全就换USDC吧，起码汇率上的损失已经越来越少，而目前又是一个用汇率说话的时代。

title: Espresso 交互教程
body:
## 项目背景：

Espresso目的是建立一个可扩展的web3隐私解决方案,目前由红杉资本领投$3200W。现在还处于非常早期阶段，值得一做。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/l0raK9RlDn-alaJmTj4u-.png?height=714&width=1270)

### 本次教程需要搭建VMware虚拟机环境，并安装ubuntu

推荐用腾讯的软件中心下载VMware，因为官网在国外，下载速度很慢。

[腾讯软件中心](https://pc.qq.com/detail/0/detail_21600.html)

下载完成后，按照文章安装搭建步骤很详细。文章是两年前的文章，VMware版本还是14，现在是16，都是一样安装。

[虚拟机安装教程](https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/141033713)

搭建好虚拟机和系统后，再安装Docker

[docker安装教程](https://kalacloud.com/blog/how-to-install-and-use-docker-on-ubuntu)

docker成功安装之后，执行

`docker-compose pull`

如果报错：docker-compose 命令不存在，则进行安装

`sudo apt install docker-compose`

安装完成继续执行

`sudo docker-compose pull`

按Y等待安装完成，接着执行

`sudo docker-compose up`

出现如下结果，则为成功

![钱包运行成功](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bBBzf4eVDSkkprfBPS0gP.png?height=720&width=1748)

现在可以在浏览器内URL栏打开：localhost，就能看到钱包在运行

![钱包启动界面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yQ0VYDoH2Zg1Z5rSq6Oj7.png?height=658&width=1279)

至此，前期准备工作全部完成，开始真正的测试：

**1.设置新钱包**

![新钱包](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g2r-KDZzXg7vKbo3fRM3y.png?height=641&width=1279)

2\.点击“**reveal keys**”保存助记词，将自己的助记词妥善保存，之后可用于恢复钱包

**3.命名钱包恢复文件**

![命名](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nEhXp14VUvXlFZAngHlBu.png?height=885&width=1275)

**4.设置钱包密码**

![设置密码](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rREZ8igEvKu19tFjIPGzf.png?height=879&width=1278)

**5.创建钱包**

![创建钱包](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PO0tdY9c5xpoiAphL1iTL.png?height=856&width=1261)

**6.领取测试代币**

![领取测试币](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dEDUXCNKz7F2Q6BKAGaph.png?height=885&width=1290)

**7.回到首页，连接钱包，注意要切换到goerli链**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/i2JIc0xvmnT1I4mz38aox.png?height=1025&width=1276)

由于本次使用虚拟机安装Ubuntu进行测试，浏览器没有小狐狸钱包，所以使用手机钱包(本人手机钱包为TP钱包)进行连接，效果一样。不过首先得添加goerli链，和电脑上大致相同，钱包内打开[Chainlist](https://chainlist.info/)，搜索goerli添加上即可。

或者直接在浏览器里安装小狐狸然后倒入助记词也是可以的。

![手机连接钱包](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GtWyiknamWG9jfKrZcbLa.jpg?height=2532&width=1170)

**8.到“Account”页面生成一个新钱包地址**

![新地址](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2RP_HxiiVnfTlcXfH10vC.png?height=790&width=1546)

**9.发送一些代币到新钱包地址**

![发送代币](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/UOdJkW4Man-VlHfDQFmN6.png?height=938&width=1521)

**10.创建新的ERC-20资产**

![添加新资产](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dyAbUp-X4RN6T146Ez4Mh.png?height=888&width=1541)

goerli有余额的代币合约，可以去[ethscaner](https://goerli.etherscan.io/)里搜索自己钱包，然后查看有余额的代币，图中所示就是你钱包里的代币余额。选取第一个然后复制代币合约填入上述页面即可。

![代币余额](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LSyBGkCk9oPWRAve9QGcW.png?height=1199&width=2334)

填入第一个代币ATOM的合约地址

![添加合约](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vTL6XbuU6eOPUkTcjrTsW.png?height=1014&width=1532)

往下拉，我们会看到还有两个信息需要填写

![两个key](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3m8Aj6td1I3uBfWgD80o8.png?height=1017&width=1516)

一个是**viewing key**，另一个**freezing key，**这俩信息需要在“**Account**”页面生成

![viewing key](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/i85P34hRv3tQsvUNvd0gP.png?height=694&width=1570)

![freezing key](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/s0duekPz3H2VeBP1YA-sg.png?height=743&width=1577)

然后将这俩key保存，并填入到刚才的资产页面，注意选项都勾选上，然后点击创建。需要等待几分钟

![填入key](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VnvCSgsqHG7Tua54-2wjj.png?height=1024&width=1600)

其实如果不需要在“资产查看密钥”和“资产冻结密钥”部分选择启用查看交易金额和交易地址，以及启用该资产类型的交易冻结。可以不用勾选后面选项也可以生成新资产。

![新资产](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eQQdFULy5IF5cJlkKP5Es.png?height=1114&width=1700)
